Reviews.Title: “Great location for all areas of Rome”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyMonsoon
Reviews.Content: Great location, particularly to get to trastevere where all the bars and restuarants are. Room very stylish, but lost some functionality because it was quite bare. More storage space and dressing table mirror needed. Great breakfast, good value and overall very pleased with the value and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great, though your sausages were a little funky”
Reviews.Author: Andy844
Reviews.Content: Well, there were a smorgasbord of experiences at reception, from friendly Uncle/Aunt to vile young uptight nylon trouser wearing sweaty knackers. Also at breakfast. I do not really appreciate being told where to sit. The huffing and puffing. 'But there are so many more places to sit'. No. I am a guest and I'll sit wherever I want. So we did. More huffing. Prices for the mini bar are STUPID. £4 for bad chocolate. £4 for a tiny beer. You can get it next door for 200% less, and a smile. Niggles over, room very spacious and very clean. Although we did have to remind reception that we ordered an executive suite. Twice. Great location for exploring trasta. Good links to the city. A bit of a prison cell. Bit 80's. Well, late 80's. Ohh, your sausages were tiny, fat, great but a little funky. A xx ps overall it was very good

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: miciamso
Reviews.Content: I don't know if I got upgraded or what, but we loved our room. We got a HUGE room with a little balcony. I thought the overall theme of the hotel was fun and different. No, it was not perfect, no hotel will ever be perfect for one person, but I found the price quality relationship to be quite fair. The front desk was a little condescending but otherwise nice and helpful. The breakfast was good and the decor was fun. I loved being able wander right through trastervere, or to jump right on the 8 tram and head to the historic center. It was also easy to get to and from the airport with the trastevere train station and tram. It probably helps that I am very familiar with the city, but I thought the location was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel yet doesnt worth the money u pay”
Reviews.Author: lola2882
Reviews.Content: Staye there for over a week.we thought is better to book a hotel close to trastever,an area with nightlife.the breakfast was great.they had eggs go pastries and fruits.the decor is very minimal and modern yet the room are old fashion.they have very small beds and not comfortable at all!

Reviews.Title: “Would definately recommend”
Reviews.Author: F B
Reviews.Content: Very good location near to tram/bus stop. Some excellent bars and restaurants in the local area. Hotel = very quiet, very good breakfast. The room was very spacious and clean. I think it was probably awaiting redecoration with the new Ripa concept as it looked like a former self catering apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Honest hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: LondonTripmember
Reviews.Content: Ripa hotel is an honest hotel with a resaonbale price (booked through booking.com). The location is really as Tasvetere is a nice area with a lot of restaurnat, trattoria and bar. You can also be in the city center in 15mn walk and there bus stop and tramway all along the road. Common area are clean and modern but the elevator are very slow. For the room in itself, even if t was clean and spacious, the design is a bit old fashioned and they could get more out of it by changing the set up. There was plenty choice for Breakfast. Staff was smily and helpful. I would say that my general stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine”
Reviews.Author: WJOHN228
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location near to buses, trams and trains and a 5 minute walk from the heart of Trestevere with its lively bars and retaurants. The buffet breakfast is good with a wide selection of items. The rooms are spacious. It ooks like they were previousy self catering apartments because there is a kitchenette with a couple of electric rings (no longer in use) No coffee making in the rooms and the bed was a bit hard. The lighting arrangements don't really fit the layout of the room. There is a couch and table in a living area but you can't sit there without having the main light on - so no chance of reading there whilst someone is asleep in the bed.area. These are minor niggles. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Average, but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Paovy
Reviews.Content: I saw pics thru booking website, I booked it right away cuz' it's reasonable price and hotel look great. When I arrived, I was disappointed. Hotel was older than it showed on website. The rest was ok. I wish I looked around more before decided.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and tremendous value!”
Reviews.Author: twoAmericantourists
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a deal on Travelzoo and our experience was wonderful. First, the hotel is a little tricky to find. If coming from the airport, take the train to Trastevere (8 Euros). When you come out of the station you can either take the tram towards Argentina Square. (It's about 3 stops - get off at Piazza Bernardino da Felte) or you can walk. It's about 15-20 mins. (a bit further than stated on the hotel’s directions with your booking confirmation.) Go right, when you come out of the train station, following the tram tracks, until you get to Bernardinoo da Felte (it's a small square with a lot of parked cars on the right). Turn right here, and the hotel is on the left down a side alley. Front desk - everyone was very helpful. They provided a map, food recommendations, which buses/trams to get to the sights, and sold bus tickets. Everyone spoke good English. Room - large for Europe, modern and minimalist. Ours had a balcony and these amazing electronic shutters that blocked out all sound and light. It was extremely quiet and very clean. The only minus was that the bed was not that comfortable. We could feel the springs and our double was two mattresses put together but we found this everywhere in Italy. Breakfast - Wow! Room is huge, light and airy. Huge selection including eggs, bacon, sausage, yogurt, breads, pastries, juices, coffee, water etc. Much more than we expected for Europe. Location – We personally loved the Trastevere area. It is about 50/50 tourists/local Italians. We liked getting away from the high tourist areas. We used the bus/tram to get to the main sights. We could have walked but wanted to save our energy for walking around the actual sights! Public transport is cheap and frequent and just steps away from the hotel on the main road. We walked into Trastevere every evening for dinner (about a 10 min walk). We found the restaurants to be good value and quality compared to the other areas we visited in Italy. Our favorite was Ivo’s on Via San Francesco a Ripa (closed on Tuesdays). Order the cacio e pepe, (a local Roman dish) and all the pizzas were good. (We went there twice) We also enjoyed dinners at Popi Popi (also on Via San Francesco a Ripa) and Casetta Del Trastevere in Piazza de’Renzi (very traditional Roman food). Overall, we found the Ripa Hotel to be tremendous value, in great location and we would recommend it to friends and return next time we are in Rome. I would highly recommend staying in the Trastevere area if you want to see today’s real Rome, and easily get tired of the high tourist areas with their low quality food and high prices.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected pearl...”
Reviews.Author: sgiuliani
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to Rome on a business trip and as it happens sometimes, my client who was in charge of arranging my accommodation, didn't do such a great job. As a result, I arrived in Rome with nowhere to stay... because of a misunderstanding with my original booking. I was practically stranded after arriving from the airport and supposed to conduct an orchestra the morning after! I remembered that a friend of mine once mentioned the Ripa Hotel and I managed to find the number and call. I was blessed to hear that they had one room left for that very night! I arrived there with my luggage and was helped right away in a very courteous manner by the staff. I was pleased to notice the beautiful decor and the attention to details in the lobby's design. I was lead to my room on the third floor and I couldn't have been happier. The style was somewhat minimal and elegant at the same time, without compromising comfort. The bathroom was very well designed and as soon as I saw the bathtub I couldn't help using it right away.. with great pleasure. I would highly recommend this nice hotel to anybody who's looking to stay away from big anonymous chains hotels and at the same receive a great service. If you wish to have a wonderful experience in one of the most beautiful cities in the world you might want to consider this hotel. I went to work the next day with a smile on my face and felt lucky to have found this pearl, so unexpectedly.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish elegant hotel with superb staff”
Reviews.Author: 49ers1972
Reviews.Content: I wanted to propose to my wife in Rome, so I suggested we have a vacation right after Christmas. We picked the Ripa hotel based on the location and reviews, this is definitely a 4 star hotel with comfortable and stylish rooms but the best part of our stay was the staff. The day before I wanted to propose I was getting nervous and I was still undecided on how to do it, so I decided to ask an advice to the concierge. Sabina and Patricio were superb! Sabina brought us breakfast the following morning, on the tray there was a basket of rose petals with the ring inside. My (now) wife said yes and I became the happiest man in the word! Patricio, thanks again for your advice, whenever you want to visit San Francisco, a ticket to see the 49ers will be on me!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not so nice experience”
Reviews.Author: laryan0616
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I wanted a hotel within walking distance to The American School in Rome as we were attending/presenting at a conference there. We chose Hotel Ripa based on information found on the internet. Upon arrival, the desk staff were very friendly and helpful (and bilingual). Our room was very accommodating, but nothing fancy. There were two instances that were not met with satisfaction from us during our stay. First, our room was cleaned during the day while were were away from the hotel. Once we returned to find a long black hair in the sink and one in the bidet (which we never used and would not belong to either of us). This same night, we found cigarette butts on the balcony floor and in our trash can. On another night, after returning from dinner, we found our balcony door open. Not unlocked, but unlocked and open (about a foot wide). We were startled to walk into a dark room, turn the lights on, and see this! We are two women traveling abroad alone, so this did not settle well at all! After searching the room over, we went downstairs to report this. The hair and cigarette incident seemed insignificant compared to the door, but we reported both. Hotel management was conerned and did say they would address the problem with the appropriate staff member. On another night, I wanted to purchase wi-fi minutes so I could Skype home, so I went to the desk and asked to purchase the minutes. The male clerk, Patrizio, took my money and gave me change and the coupon and password needed to sign on. I had a question with the exchange as I paid in dollars (as we had done 3 night previously) but their cost was calculated in Euros. When I proposed my question to Patrizio, he was obviously insulted (for some reason), raised his voice, and loudly exclaimed, "It is VERY EASY, Madame! You gave me this... I gave you that... It IS correct!" I was quite taken aback by his abrupt answer and retreated to my room, all the while, mumbling under my voice. The more I thought about it, the more frustrated I became as I recounted my change and still didn't agree nor understand his calculations. So I returned down to the desk and approached him again by saying, "I am still confused about this transaction. I just don't understand how my change is this amount. I am not stupid, I just don't understand. Can you please explain this to me again?" He left the desk area, went to a calculator, pushed some series of buttons, tore off the tape, and placed the paper in front of me, again exclaiming, "Madame, this is VERY EASY! You see, the total is there (as he points to the paper)." So I just politely told him "I am obviously American. In America, customers can ask others questions without being yelled at. It's my money, I'm spending it here with you. I have just said I don't understand the transaction and have just asked for assistance with it. Nothing more. What I don't expect is to be yelled at by you. It's not what I'm paying for." He quickly rebuked and said, "No.. Madame, Madame... you misunderstood me. I"m so sorry you misunderstood me." I quickly interjected, "there's no misunderstanding the fact that you were rude and you are rude." I asked him for the name of his manager and he gave me a blank piece of paper and placed a pen on top of the paper. He then spoke the name of his manager. So I wrote it down and assured him I would be in touch with her. I did follow up with the manager and she was apologetic, but assured me there must have been some sort of communication barrier. I say NO WAY! People can talk with their bodies, actions, jestures, eyes, etc... regardless of the language barrier. This guy was either having a bad day, didn't like Americans (or blondes), didn't like being questioned. As a customer, I feel I have the right to question any charge. I hope some things have changed there. Don't think I'd be recommending this hotel to anyone. It's a shame to say as I'm sure all of Rome is not the same.

Reviews.Title: “Space Odyssey but a nice one”
Reviews.Author: spotbot1
Reviews.Content: Well a quirky/retro hotel tucked away in Trastervere, with funky seating & an even funkier dining room but in a nice smiley way, if you know what I mean. The room was large & very comfortable, though a few draws wouldn't go a miss, there was an excellent choice at breakfast but the best thing about the Hotel was the helpful staff, who assisted us at every turn & answered all our trivial tourist questions, giving directions etc, even booking our visit to Villa Bourgeses & arranging a Mercedes Limo transfer to the airport, after we were let down by our transfer company Resorthoppa. The Hotel is ideally placed for good reasonably price restaurants & a fabulous Coffee shop called Bar Quadrant at the road end, cross the road & walk left 100yards, we went every day sometimes twice, you'll understand if you go,also Hostaria Del Moro (known as Tony's) was very good, there were plenty of nice cheap (10 Euro) menu's of 3 or 4 courses for tourists & if you tire of Italian an excellent Chinese off Piazza Santa Teressa, however give Pucci's a miss, very expensive & not very inviting. I won't tell you were to go, it's all there laid out before you & if your reasonably fit you can walk it all, we did. btw the Hotel is undergoing a facelift so there's some noise during the day but it didn't disturb us & the place is in need of a little lick of paint etc.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Electricbaz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with girlfriend for 2 nights! Very nice hotel, modern themed, easy to find. Room was spacious and clean, bed was nice too. Really liked the breakfast in the morning, plenty of choice (though I didn't find the crossaints very nice). Front desk was friendly and spoke great english. Our flight home wasn't until the evening, but they let us leave our bags with them even though we had already checked out, which was great! Also very close to the centre! Probably 15 minutes walk. Would definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Utilitarian hotel”
Reviews.Author: Popovova
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights on a recent business trip. The pictures on the internet or the in-room brochure don't match the room where I stayed. The hotel is old, but there has been an attempt to update the design to a modern theme. This works well in the very nice breakfast room, which serves a decent buffet of hot and cold foods with lots of fresh fruits and breads. The modern theme works less well in the rooms. My room was a decent size, but a strange set up, with no real closet and a half wall in the middle of the room with the bed. The TV was at the foot of the bed on a padded bench. There was no work area. Lighting was insufficient, despite the large number of fixtures on the wall. The bathroom was very small and dated. The bed was not particularly comfortable and the over-starched linens had a heavy chemical smell. On a positive side, there was a small balcony. The front desk service was very good, even managing to arrange a taxi during the taxi strike.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Prague, Hlavni Mesto Praha, Czech Republic
Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4* hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Petr R
Reviews.Content: As we looked at the pictures from the catalogue we (3 adult people) decided that this hotel would be a perfect choice; however, the reality was quite different. From the outside the hotel looks very ugly but the lobby is well designed and clean. When we arrived, the receptionist was very nice and spoke English quite well; nevertheless, the first impression of our room was terrifyng since it was completely different from what we saw in the catalogue. I fully understand that one can not simply expect exactly the same rooms from the catalogues but this was like a nightmare. When we wanted to open the window we found a scaffolding in front of it carrying workers that were recostructing the building therefore we were not able to open that window for the whole vacation. The next thing was that one of us had to sleep in separated room, but the problem was that there was no bed, only a couch. When we tried to complain at the reception, the receptionist suddenly wasnt able to speak English and didnt understand what the problem was. After 15 minutes of our complaining we finally got extra bed but the staff helping us was very unpleasant. The biggest problem was the noise in the hotel lobby since one of us had to sleep in the room right behind the entrace doors to our room from the hall. After the first night we tried to get different room since sleeping in such conditions was almost impossible but we failed in that although the hotel almost empty (we were there in December). The only positive facts were breakfasts and the possibility of buying tickets for Vatican museum and public transport. One has to admit that the breakfasts there were really great - very large selection of everything. Definitely wont comeback there!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite good as you would expect”
Reviews.Author: Riikka P
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked very nice when we looked at the pictures on their wesites. So we booked it and were a bit surprised when we reached our room. It was clean and huge but not too homy. There was no other lights than the big ones in the ceiling. The sofa fabric was wore out. Good things about the room was the chance to prepare meals: a cooking stow and a fridge. But we didn't use it. From the hotel it was easy to go out and eat in Trastevere and to the city centre you could take a bus or a tram. Also trastevere train station is near, 15 min by foot or 5 min by tram/bus. From that station goes the trains to airport. and btw you really should buy a 1-7 day ticket that includes train from airport to trastevere and back, buses, trams and metro. It was only 23 e/week when comparing to eg leonard express from airport to termini which costs 16 e one way... And the breakfast was very nice! (although it was not supposed to be included for us but it was :) )

Reviews.Title: “Design rooms”
Reviews.Author: bencomum
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family in November 2011. Location is really good very close to the Tramway directly into the main part of town. It's also close enough to the busy restaurant area of the Trastevere without having to put up with the noise. Room was enormous with two bedrooms separated by a modern unpolished glass wall from the main room. Though it was expensive (about 200€/night, but including a full breakfast) but then again capital city prices. Hotel staff were OK though not that helpful. Major problem was that the breakfast room was a little too small and understaffed at peak time. Had to wait several times for a table to be cleared. very trendy design though.

Reviews.Title: “My personnel experience seems different to others”
Reviews.Author: dinger1979
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Ripa 4th-7th Dec i couldnt praise this hotel high enough.Threw Thomas Cook i got flights from Belfast to Fiumicino and 3nights stay for £445 for me and my fiancee.I am a google freak and did a bit of research on the area travelling to city centre sights restaurants etc.I asked the hotel threw email is there any chance of a complimentary upgrade as not only was it my girlfriends birthday on the Monday but i planned to get engaged.We only had a basic standard room booked.When at the airport there is 3 train lines.termini in the centre and to the left 1 to Travestere.It was only 8euro and about the 6th stop.this was so handy as i was reading taxi prices to here was 60 even 70euro.When we arrived at the station the hotel was about 3tram stops we got off at a big massive government building you see on the left.the hotel is on the right.Really really easy to find.Now when we arrived at 9pm all staff were so friendly they took our luggage to room and check in was quick being a Sunday night we expected this.When they emailed me back they stuck to there word we were upgraded to a suite on the 7th floor it had a kitchen balcony mini bar loads of room.good bathroom nothing faulty or untidy i couldnt say anything disapointed me.Being in Travestere it was perfect timing to unpack and take a 5-10 min at the most to pizza Santa Maria which is the livelist place in Rome with restaurants still taking folk and lovely romantic small bars were u could drink outside.Even though it was December it was still 17degrees at night.Like i say the tram runs into the city centre to Argentina every 5mins which is 5mins walk from Panthelon and piazza Navona were i got engaged.The Vatican we walked in 25mins 1 morning walking along the riverbank to the left of Trastevre.The Collusium is another 20min walk to the right of the hotel no tram needed as we passed the Mouth of Truth, Circus Maximus etc .I just want to give my personnal experience of how good and easy this hotel is to access room.Its modern in a funky way as the pictures show and the whole breakfast experience is true they even have 2-3 bottles of champagne on ice if you fancy that.but we stuck to the coffee.A good breakfast is what you need to to have energy to walk and take in probably the best city in Europe .I have been to Paris twice and prefer Rome for romance food and sightseeing.Dont hesitate book here .If you already have i am sure you will enjoy and hope i have helped you.Also a special thanks to all the staff at the Ripa for giving my fiancee a bottle of free champagne on ice when we arrived back midday on the Monday on her birthday ,many thanks x

Reviews.Title: “Great Continental Breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: Trisha H
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I are big-breakfast-people and our our enthusiasm for eggs and bacon, in recent trips, seems to have not been shared by our European counter parts...until we stayed at hotel Ripa that is! We were delightfully surprised to be greeted each morning by a huge breakfast buffet that was bigger and more decadent than any other continental breakfast I have ever experienced - we are talking: granola, various cereals, 10 different kinds of fruits, scrambled eggs, choices of breakfast meats, toast, espresso, mimosas etc... Great way to start the day! Also the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful - the maids especially took extra care of cleaning our room. Great powerful shower with hot water although a little small and the beds are not extremely comfortable... Very well located in Trastevere - next to tram stop and 2 tram stops away from Trastevere train station. Great modern design and art!

Reviews.Title: “modern and friendly”
Reviews.Author: twinad29
Reviews.Content: This is a nice clean hotel with a modern twist. We were a little concerned when we arrived as the hotel itself is not immediately obvious, it is not a very attractive building, and the street itself is not where you would expect to find a hotel. The location makes it very easy to get to all the key tourist spots, either by tram, bus or foot. The rooms are funky, but some of the fittings and lights were a little tired, the glass sliding door to the bathroom does not allow for much privacy. The only truly disappointing feature of the room was the shared balcony; the balcony was very small and was accessible from our room as well as the room next door. This meant you were not really able to use it, and you did not really want to open the curtains. Breakfast is ok, although I would avoid the juice, and try to avoid the busiest times as can get quite loud.

Reviews.Title: “Great design and super location!”
Reviews.Author: lilo m
Reviews.Content: Ripa Hotel is at Trastevere area.Every morning you can take the tram, its really close on foot and go to any spot you want in Rome. At night the hotel is just soo close on foot to the must places to go for walk- beer- drinks! Trastevere at night is fascinating! We were spending our nights at Trastevere (at cute small bars) and it was very good because when you want to go for sleep you are sooo close! The only negative is that the hotel has small elevators!(I m claustrophobic,I had to use the stairs)

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Hayleyrigg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business trip. The reception is very nicely done, modern and funky, the staff helpful. But on entering the room - it was like I was in a completely different hotel - 3 stars at best. The room was spacious, I would give it that but decor wise it was more like something from the value section of a Ikea showroom - NOT a 4 star hotel. It was basic, cheap and tired. I also was woken up several times in the night by noisy guests in the corridor! The restaurant was funky, bright and clean with a good breakfast. The food in the bar was very tasty. Location wise - the area is just a residential area of Rome but a 10-15 minute walk and you are in the 'tourist area'. The hotel is well situated for trams and buses and the Trastevere mainline station for the airport and centre.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: Meyhofer
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel 1st because of it's location and 2nd because of the price. We got a comp. drink upon arrival, breakfast was inclusive and very good, a bit busy too. Staff was great and helpful. Rooms are a bit dated but very spacious, TV was very small but when didn't use it. Safety box did not work but that was quickly fixed by engineer. It is perfect if you only use it for breakfast and sleep.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: drxmas2005
Reviews.Content: very big rooms,nice bad,nice breakfast! easy location to go in town!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel staff are excellent”
Reviews.Author: NelsonSuts
Reviews.Content: Good service throughout - all staff greeted us and smiled throughout our short stay (4 Nights) and could answer any queries we put. The very clean room was good - different in layout from a traditional hotel room but very well designed. (The door on the fridge was a little worn and it sometimes did not close properly.) Good location south of the city - the Forum and Ancient Roman attractions easy to walk to and the Vatican too - just. Superb bus/tram service - very economical - single trip tickets available from Reception. Good restaurants/snack bars around the hotel and a supermarket just around the corner. Good food in the hotel (breakfast excellent) but a seriously restricted dining menu.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it...”
Reviews.Author: aphrodite1911
Reviews.Content: Having spent time in several hotels in Rome, I can honestly say my stay at the Ripa was perfect. The room was huge with a sitting area and little kitchenette. I felt very safe there and was able to walk to Trastevere in about 10 minutes. I walked up to Via Veneto and the Spanish Steps, St. Peter's and the Pantheon in very little time. Let it be known though that I am a very active person so even a half hour walk is nothing for me. It was also close enough to places like Piazzas Campo di Fiori and Navona. What cannot be beat about this place is their incredible breakfast. Most places will serve you a few coronetti and coffee but the Ripa puts out a spread that will keep everyone including the italians happy. In fact I am going to Rome again and after grappling with the idea of trying some place new to stay, I ended up booking with the Ripa most especially because of their breakfast. That maybe crazy but it is true... I don't know what very high end hotels in Rome are like but the spaciousness of the Ripa can't be beat because I like a lot of space and storage room. I also enjoyed the fact that I had a balcony to sit on in the evenings after a long day of walking around. As for the decor...a little dated (kind of 70 ish) but we are in Italy after all and I'm pretty sure there isn't a ton of new buildings going up. My only problem was that the shower had a hand held nozzle which I find a little annoying to use but other than that...I was very pleased overall and that is why I am returning for a 4 day stay at the beginning of my trip and 5 days at the end...

Reviews.Title: “Good service and location, but not for a long stay”
Reviews.Author: Footballerswife
Reviews.Content: Hi, Ripa Hotel works if you have visited Rome before and you need a place to stay for few nights. I would not stay here if I would visit Rome for the first time. I would some hotel that is more central. Pros: * Trastevere area is nice and with less tourists * Trastevere station is easy to reach by train from Fiumicino. Much nicer than Termini. * Very good service in the reception! * Nice breakfast Cons: * We walked from Trastevere station using instructions from google maps. That was a mistake! These instructions will take you to wrong road. It is easy to walk from the station to hotel trough the main street if you do not have luggage. * "Design" and decoration in the hotel is a bit outdated and it looks like a nightclub.

Reviews.Title: “The grim Ripa”
Reviews.Author: Kiwiguru
Reviews.Content: I try to have a rule of only writing positive reviews but for this place I'm making an exception. Don't stay at this hotel. It's a really bad choice, scuffed walls, pleathery furniture, crappy location, indifferent staff. It is not, as you would hope by reading the reviews, located in some hip corner of Rome but next to what I can only guess is a housing project. It's a walk to anything cool in the neighborhood and a huge drag to get to any of the touristy things you're probably looking for. The decor has the feeling of IKEA meets dirty nightclub. I spend 85 nights a year in hotels all over the world and this really stood out as a terrible choice. I have actually waited a month after leaving to write this review in case my loathing of the place was just caused by the Roman heat of July. But no, upon reflection it's a turkey and the good reviews on TA annoy me as they convinced me to give it a go.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, well equiped, nice designed hotel”
Reviews.Author: Goethe67
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for a private trip. Finding a hotel in Rome is easy, finding a hotel in Rome fitting your requirements is a bit more challenging. After visiting several Hotel sites and reading evaluations I decided to book the Ripa Hotel in Rome. I have to say: the hotel met our expectations completely. The room was hugh - in fact it was more like an apartment. The bed was good and the design of lobby and restaurant was modern. We enjoyed breakfast every day. Although there was no variation in teh breakfast, it was good. Coffee tasted well (important) and the breakfast buffet ofered Sekt as well - to start the day "with bubbles". The staff at the reception was very helpful and their english good. The bathroom was clean however did not meet the quality of the rest of the room. The hotel as such is located nearby public transportation in a quiet street. From the hotel St. Peter, Colosseum, Piazza Espagna etc. can be reached by foot - having a nice walk. From the airport the most easy way to reach the hotel is to use the train, get of at Transtevere station and take the tram. Takes about 1 hour and is more direct than the bus shuttle - and a lot cheaper than taxis. We could recommend this hotel and would return to it for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, design hotel”
Reviews.Author: Antwerpgirl_10
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located, deliciously designed hotol for a citytrip and retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Was maybe cool 15 years ago”
Reviews.Author: Abeille-Jaune
Reviews.Content: Good & quiet location, nice breakfast, big rooms are the positive aspects. The hotel has lost its splendor, would need a complete renovation. The main hall looks very much better than the rooms. Personal quite friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Do not expect so much of this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LRLUCAS
Reviews.Content: Well, this not the worst hotel in Italy but certainly you will find better ones. In fact, it was reasonably good. The front desk attention follows the typical Italian style. Some loud voices and lots of gesture (they talk with their hands, do not forget it) but it was not unkind. That's the way they are and we must respect and tolerate the differences. Location is very strange and streets are narrow. Lifts are small, rooms are fairly large but they urgently need to refurbish them. Maintenance is not a high priority here. The hotel cries for help because it was something years ago, we can realize that. Outside we can see the lack of cement and paint. Bricks are exposed. Internet connection is very expensive and I highly recommend you to go to the Via Leopoldo Serra where you find internet access for 2 Euros instead of a 13 Euros charge. Bright side: Breakfast is very good indeed and the waitresses are nice. The building design is very nice and modern. Interesting room layout. TIP: There are several good restaurants around and public transportation for those who want to experience a nice adventure. Keep your eye open to your possessions or someone else will take care of it.

Reviews.Title: “Nope!”
Reviews.Author: VeraBenini
Reviews.Content: Receptionist very unkind. Détestable! Design is so cool, but shower is not well designed: it is black somewhere, breakfast room is so noisy because architect didn't think about walls' surface anti-noise treatment, and being in Italy the ungorgivable thibg ever: coffee is horrible. I won't come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, staff, and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Fancy047
Reviews.Content: The Ripa was a great hotel. The prices are reasonable and the breakfast is exceptional! It is located next to a great part of Rome that feels less touristy. The junior suite feels like an apartment and had blackout curtains for sleeping in. Also air-conditioning is a plus. The hotel is clean and and the staff is very helpful. They suggested great restaurants and helped with reservations. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “couldnt have been better!~”
Reviews.Author: brooklynbuba88
Reviews.Content: I booked the Ripa Hotel from a friend's recommendation who had stayed there before. I was worried bc I read a few of the reviews from trip advisor but once I had stayed there I was glad I listened to my friend! I couldnt have asked for a better location (in new Trastevere but literally across the street from the rustic shops and restaurants of old trastevere, a 2 minute walk) which actually I think is better because old trastevere is very loud and noisy. Instead, the location at Ripa was tranquil and quiet - I got great sleep! Also, the staff was wonderful - warm, friendly, helpful, giving great restaurant suggestions, and even helping when my husband and I wanted to rent a car, they suggested a scooter instead which they had delivered right to the hotel. (Seeing Rome by scooter is fast, and a lot of fun!!) The room itself was HUGE and comfortable with a lovely balcony. Yes, everything is modern but it's really great - functional, comfy, and quiet. Breakfast was included and it was delicious. The rates were reasonable compared to other hotels in Rome and that was another plus! I will DEFINITELY be back and reccommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Must have been a great hotel at some point”
Reviews.Author: NikoPseudo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June 2011, following recommendation from the Wallpaper City Guide 2006. I should have read Trip Advisor before booking the room... Pros 1- Yes, the design of the rooms, and their layout, is interesting: all grey, cool light fixtures, nice overall architecture, great details. 2- Awkward location, kind of away from everything, but at least near Trastevere, a lively neighbourhood with great restaurants and not too many tourists. 3- Included breakfast was surprisingly good. Cons 1- Service is disappointing. I had to fight to get a room change as my AC did not work properly, and no one thought of telling about the 25 Euro Rome card, or about the 29 June fireworks. And there's always only one person on duty, so you have to sit around and wait whenever you need something. Service was curt and minimal. 2- The place shows its age badly. Air con units were obviously added as after-thought, probably after the Central AC (gratings still visible) collapsed and wasn't fixed, light bulbs were busted, walls were in poor condition, bathroom was poorly maintained. The whole of the hotel façade was undergoing facelift. My shutter blinds ceased to work after the first day... It's all funny ah ah, but for the price I paid, I was moderately amused. What must have been a cool hotel a few years ago is turning into a sad example of what happens when maintenance is forgotten about and service is considered superfluous. If you can stay somewhere else, do so.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, especially for young folks.”
Reviews.Author: Theodore2310
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel overall. No metro connectivity makes it somehow difficult when one needs to visit the most famous attractions of Rome. The hotel also definitely needs renovation. The location is safe and very good for nightlife although the hotel is not in a noisy area. I would recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Bad atmophere and bad duty”
Reviews.Author: Kikijuro
Reviews.Content: We spend 3 nights in this hotel. The welcoming was awfull, people not kind, asking for ID very roughly for our "security". Suspicious ! And when we ask for a second key, they refused for our "security" (again). The people on duty for breakfast were not kind either. When we ask for some tea, they just answer : "no more tea, look for on other tables !!" Charming. We pay 145 euros per night. Too expensive for such a duty !!! I don't ask to be treated like the Queen of England… but some smiles would had been great. I forget to tell : 5 euros to connect Internet. The "pompom" as we say in France Sylvie S.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: andyl2005
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 3 night break in Rome and stay at the ripa hotel. It's nothing spectacular from the outside, but the interior in clean and modern. Check in was a little slow but staff were nice and friendly. Rooms are an unusual layout, but very practical and spacious. We were very happy with room although thte shower was a little tempermental. Trastevere is an excellent base for exploring rome, with the no. 8 tram only 2 mins away. Breakfast was nice, but you need to get down early to avoid been left with the leftovers! Thought it was a little cheeky of a four star to charge for wifi - save your money and avail of free wifi in one of several bars (an example is the bulldog bar near argentina square) Also buy a roma card to dodge the Q 4 the colleseum! All in all would return to roma and the ripa!

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: LIESQ
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Rome where I spent 2 unpleasant nights at the Hotel Ripa with my 21 year old daughter. The hotel style is modern and stark. At check in my daugher and I had to take our 3 large suitcases up to our room. No one offered to help. When we arrived in our room, it clearly smelled of stale cigarette smoke. Since we had requested a non-smoking room, I called the front desk and asked for a room change. I was told that no other rooms were available and that all rooms were non-smoking rooms. When I indicated that I would rather change to another hotel and lose my one night non-refundable deposit than stay in the smelly room, they found another room for us. A man was dispatched to bring us our new room key, take us to our new room and "help" us with our bags. The man gruffly grabbed one bag and we were responsible for the rest. The new room was fine until the clogged shower drain caused a flood in our bathroom. Since the shower is modern and has no door, and the shower floor is essentially the same as the bathroom floor, the flood spilled out of the bathroom and onto the carpet in the room. We cleaned up as best we could and then alerted the hotel staff. Because the staff didn't bother to deal with the problem, the carpet stayed wet and we spent the remainder of our stay in a room that smelled like a cross between wet dirty dog and mold. The first night we purchased 24 hours of wifi for 13 euros. When it didn't work, the hotel sent the same man to our room who was unable to help us and essentially walked away without any resolution. After 45 minutes, we were finally able to figure out the problem and get it to work. The next day, I purchased 1 more hour of wifi at a cost of an additional10 euros. Once again, it didn't work so I took a walk down to the front desk. At 10 euros for an hour of internet, I wanted it to work. This time, the man at the front desk was abrasive and incredibly rude. He actually threw a piece of paper at me in anger! It was crazy. Since we had just had the most wonderful experiences in the Rome Cavalieri and the Westin Excelelsior this hotel was like a slap in the face.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nice people”
Reviews.Author: tibalu
Reviews.Content: Hi, Been there for a five days trip.. First time i went to Roma. Well, the only things i would complain about are the following : not the modern place the best rooms show on hotel site, but they are pleasant and large enough althought too noisy ( doors are noisy ( it's so easy to put necessary stuffs to avoid noise !!!) and also you can hear neighbours looking at tv set .. and you must also avoid fruit juice at breakfast time . Except this ...All the rest is very nice, service is great !!! people always available to help , breakfast good , bar nice, very well located in Trastavere part and in conclusion a good choice. We did pay 160 euros for two double beds. At that price it was ok. Plus you have the station to get to the airport very close to the hotel .. Appart of this the déco is modern and finally not too bad.. we really enjoyed our stay..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Smart rooms, Very Freindly staff”
Reviews.Author: IanKirby1984
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the easter Bank holiday and we had a fantastic time there. Hotel was very clean, our room was always made up for us when we got back of an evenig any clothes that was left out was neatly folded and layed on the bed. The Bed was very comfortable, the shower was excelent and that bath was nice and deep! The breakfast was very nice. Full continental. We had breafast every mornng and never had to eat during the day. We asekd for a nice view and the hotel gave us one. Our flight was not till 10pm so we stayed in Rome till 7pm and the hotle held our bags for us untill we needed them. The only down side was the noise from some of the other guest, but thats not the staffs fault. Over all a very plesant stay! Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Great location value for money”
Reviews.Author: Greenchichester
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as had good reviews and got a great price through Thomas cook. Got the train from the airport only 8 euros. The hotel is very clean the the staff speak great English, room was an interesting layout but bed was great. We took the number 8 metro into Rome everyday, costs 1 euro and only takes 5 min. We didn't realise you had to buy the tickets from the news stands first but we soon got the hang of it. If you take the metro the other direction you can get it direct to the train station. Hotel breakfast was great lots of choice. Would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and nice room.”
Reviews.Author: petgob
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Everything fine, only a bit noisy with sounds from surrounding rooms and corridors.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel,in good area near the centre of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: koula24
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel,in good area of Rome. Nice Breakfast no complaints there.Only thing that we disliked was the checking in time which was at 2 in the afternoon. We arrived at 10 in the morning and we had to leave the hotel and walk around the centre of Rome until that time.We had a nice and comfortable room,very quiet as it was in the back rooms looking over a parking area. The bathroom was not cleaned properly and new towels were'nt put in at all in all of our 4 days that we were there . Otherwise lovely staff very helpful in every way I will go again.

Reviews.Title: “What a smell!”
Reviews.Author: lynnandcam
Reviews.Content: Hotel was ok, stayed one night and the location was great. After a few trys to find the place and we got to know the routes it was very easy to get around! Hotel room was spacious but patio walls a little bit to low so had to be careful on the 4th floor looking over..wouldn't let a kid go out there alone...BATHROOM however had a smell that was sickening, plugged the holes and shut the door when we went to bed however when we went in there in the morning the smell was like walking through a sewer! When we go again we will have this hotel as a last choice and if we ever do stay there again I'll be asking to see the room!

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: Viges
Reviews.Content: V stylish. The Trasevere district is just a few tramstops into the city centre. On day two we walked to the Vatican via a hilly park with a panoramic view over the city. (Garibaldi's monument is in this park). The hotel is not near the main Termini railway station but if you take the stopping train from Fiumicino airport it stops at Trastevere. From there it is a 15min walk or a few tramstops.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of Hotel in Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: DRG2011
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I decided on a three day excursion to Rome over New Year's Weekend. Not knowing much about the Ripa, we took a recommendation from my girlfriend's colleague. The decision to stay at the Ripa was fantastic. The hotel style is modern and edgy, while maintaniing a very welcoming feel.. The staff are friendly and helpful. Our room was great, a suite with an expansive balcony over-looking the Tiber. The rooms are reasonably priced. It is easy to get to main sites of Rome from the hotel. The staff was helpful in recommending methods of transporation to get to our desired destinations. The Trastevere area of Rome, without the tourist vibe, is a great place to find multiple restaurants where all other patrons are Italian, and within walking distance of the Ripa. . Breakfast at the Ripa is great and there were multiple nationalities at this hotel. We were very satisfied with our experience at the Ripa. We highly recommened the Ripa to travelers. Look forward going back soon! Ciao.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Renovated and Clean”
Reviews.Author: giorgosLamia_Greece
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a renovated minimal style, 4-star hotel, the Trastevere. Right in front of it, you can catch the tram number 8 (it runs very often) that goes to piazza Argentina (city centre). When we checked in, we were (automatically) upgraded to an executive room! Thank you Arianna!

Reviews.Title: “Long in the Tooth”
Reviews.Author: Babamae
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because someone recommended Travestere. The hotel facade is very long in the tooth, and looks like it needs to be renovated. Our room itself was acceptable-very modern but there was minimal furniture in the sitting area and not coffee table, and the pieces looked like a garage sale. The bathroom and bed were fiine. The night staff is surly. The breakfast buffet was fine but the hotel charged for internet at outrageous prices. Our other hotels did not charge. the neighborhood is dirty, lots of graffiti, and you have to keep you eyes onthe ground so avoid the dog feces..

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Bellavita54
Reviews.Content: A good base is good, thats why i was pleased with my choice for Ripa Hotel. Ripa hotel is perfect!!! In every way! Location, service cleanliness and so on! Located in Trastevere you can walk to any beautifull place in the city. Public transport just around the corner! My room, spacious, light and very clean!! Atmosphere in the hotel very relaxing and you feel comfortable being there. Service....Ripa staff is very very polite and willing to help you with anything you ask them!!Patrizio grazie for your help too..you were very kind!! Last but not least ;) Dear Roberta, i would like to thank you so much for everything you have arranged. You are so kind! You really did a good job. The view is carved in my memory. Grazie!! Without any doubt i would return to Ripa hotel and recomment this hotel to anyone! A presto e grazie mile per tutti!! Victoria

Reviews.Title: “Ultra contemporary”
Reviews.Author: Cincy2
Reviews.Content: Full disclosure: we did not book this hotel ourselves, but were rather placed here when our original hotel had plumbing problems. I advise you to look carefully at the Il Ripa website so that you have a full sense of the vibe of this hotel. For us: it was just odd. We stayed for two nights in October for 190 EU/night. Breakfast is included. The breakfast is a buffet with plentiful offerings. I was surprised to see the coffee is self serve from a Nescafe machine. The breakfast room was pretty crowded and has loud rock n’roll music playing the entire time. Furniture is all white molded plastic. The hotel has about 70 rooms and is located next to what looks like a bankrupt apartment building. Il Ripa is within easy walking distance to the Trastevere tram, which is a small train, that you can take for transportation into Rome’s center. From there you can either walk or will need to figure out the busses to get further. The hotel is ultra modern and minimalistic and tries to be very hip. Upon check in we were required to use a bellman to escort us to our room. We certainly didn’t need help with our carryon luggage, but I guess it was good to learn how the lighting/electric worked. The bathroom has no rods or hooks to hang your towels which seems to be a bit of a paradox for a hotel who projects such a modern/hip image to not be more ecologically friendly in enabling guests to reuse towels, etc. Front desk employees were usually polite, but very reserved. We were in room 317. Our patio had no chair so you couldn’t really use it. The worst part of our stay was on a Friday eve. While we were trying to sleep after a long day of sightseeing the music coming from the disco/lounge area was so loud it was impossible to sleep. Because the hotel has a large open atrium the sound rises throughout the entire building. At 11:25 pm I went down to the front desk in my pajamas and a jacket and requested another room in a quieter location. The front desk employee shrugged his shoulders and told me that it would be impossible to move because the hotel was fully booked. This was loud, loud music. He didn’t deny this fact, or even apologize. After a few more minutes of my rather pitiful requests he did come up with another room offer, but he suggested that it wouldn’t really be any quieter and that if I could just wait until midnight the music would stop. I decided that the hassle of moving wasn’t worth it and returned to our room where we waited until midnight and the music did indeed tone down. The general clientele here appeared to be young Northern Europeans. So, if this all appeals to you, go for it. We just didn’t care for the Il Ripa at all

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large rooms and superb breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: DonnaandDenis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights here from the 15-18 October, 2010. We were travelling with 2 other couples and had 3 rooms on the 7th floor. We were at first surprised at the size of the rooms: 2 windows, large bathroom and a sitting area. There was a non- functional kitchen which was a surprise. We had read some negative reviews before we reserved but liked the area it was in so we took a chance. I agree the room was a little dated but it was very clean with the largest bathroom we had in Italy. The bed- 2 twins pushed together, were very comfortable. The Hotel was in a quiet location and we had our windows open all night. Great view of the river. The breakfast was wonderful! Fresh fruit, cheese, meats, eggs everything for all tastes. It was a great start to our days of sightseeing. The maps given out at the front desk were better then the one I had bought before leaving Montreal. The area outside the hotel had great restaurants and cafes just down the main street. A 15 minute walk to the center of Rome and we never even took a bus! We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: jgip
Reviews.Content: this hotel is very good and is located in a good area! the room we were given was large and very clean. but breakfast was not really good...

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: billcooperdallas16
Reviews.Content: wonderfull holiday in this hotel.location was very nice and rooms were clean and big.service was professional and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Leeds-scouser
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ripa hotel this week and couldn't have been happier with my choice. Great location, everything is within easy reach- either by walking or on the excellent tram a minute away. Check in staff were incredibly helpful and welcoming, and genuinely friendly. Rooms are pretty big for a city hotel, with cute designer decor and a small balcony. Quiet and comfy at night, yet only a ten minute walk to the buzzing bars and restaurants of trastevere. Trams run very frequently and are easy to use. A wonderful city and everyone we met were incredibly helpful and proud to show off their town. Cant wait to return one day. Thank you to all the staff at Ripa Hotel for helping to make a truly magical stay. X

Reviews.Title: “ok but a bit pricy”
Reviews.Author: Tersparis
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Location not easy to find with public transport, but within walking distance from the nice area of Trastevere. Old '60s or '70s building and bathroom with no charm and not really renovated, apart from the decoration. Room quite big and with cooking facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,great city”
Reviews.Author: ihin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ripa Hotel in Sept 2010 for 4 nights, We were on the second floor the room was large ,plenty of storage en-suite bathroom ,balcony all very clean. Big clean towels in bathroom which were replaced daily .Breakfast was good and being buffet you have as much or as little as you wanted .The hotel is within 20 mins walk of all Romes sites or 1 minute walk to Tram stop. A excellent hotel in rome we will come back to Rome and stop here again

Reviews.Title: “GREAT BASE IN TRASTEVERE”
Reviews.Author: jubiladoplaya
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with our recent stay at the Ripa. Our room on the third floor was nicely decorated and the bed was extremely comfortable. The staff at the Ripa are extremely helpful and friendly, and their location near the heart of Trastevere was ideal. We would not hesitate to stay here again upon our next occasion to visit Rome. Many thanks to Arianna, Albina, and the entire Ripa staff for making our stay an enjoyable one. J. Gervais Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: kbs_chicago
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ripa Hotel for an extended period when I was in Rome for work, so I got to know the hotel quite well. The location at first glance, might not be every travelers pick, but for me it was nearly perfect, just up the street from the heart of Trastevere, which is my favorite neighborhood in Rome, with little cobblestone streets and so many charming cafes and shops. And it is viable walking distance from many major attractions. Above all, I love this hotel because the staff were always so helpful, and made me feel completely at home while I was staying there. Also, because I was staying there for an extended period of time, I really, really appreciated the fact that the rooms are huge and I could spread out. Also, virtually all the rooms have terraces. This certainly isn't a flashy, beautiful hotel, but I would stay there again and recommend it to someone else in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “If you want great location, good service, clean rooms this is the place to be.”
Reviews.Author: elsapelsadogsa
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews on this site, I was a little concerned about booking this hotel. I even communicated this to the manager who assured me that the hotel was undergoing a period of phased renovation and this was possibly a reason for some of the issues; that and the fact that you can’t please everyone! My fears were unfounded. Hotel Ripa is easily found by car from Rome airport (most importantly, without having to drive through the centre of the city!) Yes, I agree with other reviewers, it looks dilapidated on the outside-but who books a hotel based on the outside? Stepping from the 40-degree heat into the air-conditioned arty lobby (after a 12 hour trip) provides a welcome relief; the staff is quietly efficient, helpful and polite. We found them useful for bus numbers and queue avoiders at the Vatican too. All requests were greeted with a smile and acquiescence. They also speak a baffling array of different languages so no one should feel lost. I think the only part that we struggled with was the small lift from the lobby as we had to get our (disabled) son out of his buggy to go upstairs, as it was a little too wide for the lift. However, our (very large)room more than made up for that small inconvenience. It was fantastic; spotlessly clean with working and efficient air con, a ready made up cot for my son, a wonderful bed, crispy white sheets and a clean bathroom with all facilities. The cleaning maids were in every day so that, apart from our mess, the room looked great after a day on the tourist trail. (Sadly lacking tea making facilities but that is such a British thing to desire, I think that the rest of the world can cope without it!)All essentials and little luxuries that you expect are here. Food wise, Breakfast is extensive and must cater for almost everyone-except the very picky. I do agree with the reviewer that said the coffee wasn’t great but that’s me looking to provide a balanced review. The breakfast room is light and airy, but I didn’t find it loud at all. And last, but certainly not least: location, location, location. Hotel Ripa is a mere150m from the tram that goes directly into the very centre of Rome. Trastevere is the place to stay in Rome if you want Italian Rome not tourist Rome; it is old, beautiful and offers a glittering array of restaurants and is still only a short walk to the main sights. I will be staying at Hotel Ripa next time I visit Rome and wouldn’t hesitate to recommend it . Thank you Arianna and your wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “One-star rooms in a four-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bryant140
Reviews.Content: You may wonder why different travelers have such radically different opinions of the rooms at Ripa. It's simple: Some of the floors have been completely renovated, and the rooms are as great as the website suggests. And some floors are just like they were 20 years ago. Our room on the second floor reminded us of a dorm room at a second-rate university. Cheap, damaged furniture, chipped paint everywhere,a stained carpet, a cramped, dingy bathroom; a mini TV from the '80s -- not what we expected when we booked a 4-star hotel. Staff were utterly unimpressed when we complained; they clearly had heard this many times and they offered us an upgrade to a very nice room at a very hefty price. We didn't take it because we felt cheated. If you go to Ripa - and yes, the location in Trastevere is excellent - make absolutely sure you know what kind of room you're getting. Or better yet: Don't reward this kind of deceptive behavior. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Great allround hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CatJam
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the Trastevere area which is a lovely part of Rome close to the river. Although most of the major sites are within walking distance it is a lot easier to hop on the bus or tram. The stops are only a 5 min walk from the hotel. It would take approx 30-40 mins to walk to the Colloseum for example. The hotel itself looks grim from the outside but is much nicer inside. We only paid for a basic room but were really pleased. The room was really big with a separate seating area, kitchen sink and fridge. The room was not fantastically modern looking but served its purpose well. The air conditioning was greatly appreciated. The breakfast was average with plenty of choice and catered for all choices. We did not have a problem with any of the staff. I would not describe this as a luxury hotel but really found little to fault it. ( We purchased a Roma pass for 25 euro each which was ideal for this hotel as provided free public transport for 3 days and included free entrance to two attractions and discounts thereafter for all others. The major advantage of the pass is that you are entitled to priority entrance so don't have to queue ! ).

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Cathrine82
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at hotel Ripa and were impressed. Many hotels in Rome offer low standard at high prices, this hotel does the opposite. At arrival we were welcomed by nice staff and told that we had been upgraded to an executive room. Large and comfortable room, nice design. The aircon was dripping, but this was fixed immediately when we told the staff. Breakfast was good, a small minus for croissants that must have been from the day before. The location is very good if you want to spend time in Trastevere, which after our opinion is the most charming part of Rome. The service-level was after our opinion great, but a few of the staff should be more in mind that they are there to help the guests. One small detail that really impressed us was when we checked out at 4 in the morning to leave for the airport, they had fixed breakfast bags for us to take with us. We can absolutely recommend this hotel and will stay there next time we go to Rome. You shouldn't expect a luxury hotel, but a good hotel that's a great value in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if every other place is booked."”
Reviews.Author: annmariehood
Reviews.Content: Online, this hotel looked like a Kimpton type--modern, whimsical, fun. But everything is pretty shabby. The halls are dingy and the rooms are falling apart: chipped bathtubs, shower rods falling down, bed slats breaking, blinds collapsing. For the most part, the staff is snobby and unhelpful. One of our rooms had a broken air conditioner. We had to call for them to fix it about 3 times a day. They did offer to change our room, but we had a large family and needed 3 rooms at least on the same hall, so we were stuck. When we asked for travel tips, we felt like we were bothering them. On our last night I did get help with a dinner reservation. the place they recommended was great. But honestly I hesitated to even ask because of their attitude. The room where breakfast is served is so loud you can't even have a conversation. It felt like a high school cafeteria--and the food was about that quality too. It could be the only place in Rome where you get a bad cup of cappuccino--iyou make it yourself out of a Nescafe machine! The one good thing about the hotel is that it is located in the Trastevere section, which is great. But I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Made Our Trip to Rome Memorable”
Reviews.Author: helenl8
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the reviews on Tripadvisor and we loved it. The location , along a back street, is a little off-putting at first, but this is in a the great neighbourhood of Trastevere Rome. It is in close proximity to a tram that will connect you with all the major sites, but if you are a walker, you can walk to the Pantheon area in approximately 30 minutes. We loved it. We loved the decor of the hotel. It has definite ultra modern flair. The staff was amazing -- a special "shout out" to Roberta who always had a smile on her face and was accommodating with a couple of special requests that we had. We stayed a total of 7 nights split with a side trip to Sorrento. We had the smaller room and then a much larger room. Both had king beds, were well-appointed and comfortable. We think that this is an excellent choice and excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “great location- not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: elenikous
Reviews.Content: The area is cool, close to trastevere which is a charming district, but the hotel is definetely not worth 4 stars. It looks like an office building, dark and old, with some contemporary but -not good enough -in my opinion- artistic touches. Our room on the sixth floor had nothing to do with the pictures on the site. it looked more like a student residence but costed like a 4 star hotel. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location, fine rooms.”
Reviews.Author: docmait
Reviews.Content: Location: In the heart of where any visitor who wants to experience Rome, not just see it, should stay. Initially i was concerned about the street itself when i arrived, but after wandering about i realised the slightly back-street appearance of the place is just Rome itself. Hotel itself was clean, safe, comfortable- a real bonus when travelling in continental Europe! So close to the heart of Trasteverre, which is an odd mix of tourists AND locals!! (i had friends who work for the UN in rome and they hang out here after work and to go eating). Staff: Fantastic. Helpful, Corteous, Friendly. We arrived at 11am (check-in is 2pm) and were immediately given a room without any problem- given we had been travelling since 3 am that was a huge bonus to be ablt to relax before exploring). Room is minimalist style so a little different from traditionalist hotel rooms, but perfectly adequate. Comfortable beds, clean and well stocked bathroom. Cleaned daily with plenty of fresh towels. I had no complaints (which is saying something as I expect excellent standards when I pay more and HATE being screwed just because I am a Tourist). Breakfast: Typical European breakfast but with efforts made at providing sausages, bacon, scrambled eggs and toast. These where not what Irish/UK/Americans would understand this to mean but given that this IS Europe, and the rest of the food was fresh, plentiful and PROVIDED then one cant really complain (this is the first time in years of travelling to Mainland Europe that i have experienced a proper effort at providing breakfast). Overall: Cheaper hotels are available but if you can afford the price then you wont feel let down or cheated by the standards. Other European hotels could learn a lesson or two form here.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJP66Antwerp
Reviews.Content: Very nice service ( Mr. Maurizio ) is TOP !!!! Rooms are WOW. Anthony Polak

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BristolBoots
Reviews.Content: We were first time visitors to Rome and the experience and service we received from the staff at the hotel has made us want to visit again soon. Our room on the 8th floor had a huge terrace overlooking the river and afforded great views of the city. It's a little out of the way, however, all the sites were in walking distance. I left an mp3 player behind but one phone call to the hotel and it was found and within 4 days it arrived home!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money in a very hip neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: gblack75
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wide at RIpa Hotel in Trastevere Rome for 4 nights on February 2010. I found the hotel through a Hip Hotels Italy guide. The hotel must have been very hip when it opened and since then has lost part of its "shine" but is still very good value for money. I made an intener reservation for a very good price and I believe that the value for money is great. The Trastevere district is very hip and up and coming while retaining the sense of a real Roman life neighbourhood. It is the preferred location for Romans for want to have a not very expensive dinner (pizza, tratoria etc) and aperitivos ( many bars are located there). The hotel needs a refurbishment in my opinions especially in the public areas but I found the room very spacious and in good shape. The prime of this hotel may have passed and the bar/restaurant that it once is now closed, but who needs them when you are in the hippest part of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very unfriendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: SaintBobCambridge
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definetly not a 4 star hotel. The room was in need of some refurbishment and lacked furniture. It's a very basic hotel in a poor location. The staff were very unfriendly and not helpful. The breakfast was the worst I have had. They run out of juices, coffee, fruit, plates and the egg and bacon was cold. There was nobody clearing the tables and people were waiting around. I complained to the Manager who was not interested and told me to contact the booking agent.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, in an industrial area but close to Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: Jenny054
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not as large as the photos suggest. Our room, although clean, was a in need of some refurbishment. Although it didn't feel like a 4 star hotel it was cool and comfortable to return to at the end of the day and the bed was super comfortable! The staff were friendly and very helpful. The main disappointment was that breakfast felt like being in a cafeteria and the coffee was atrocious. The immediate area wasn't very inspiring but it was within walking distance to areas full of character.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool rooms with helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: larsonnk
Reviews.Content: We really liked the location. All we had to do was jump on the tram to Argentina, from there you could walk to all of the cool piazza's and tourist spots. The restaurants just off the piazza's offered the best food we had in italy. would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good, different hotel”
Reviews.Author: rhartogs
Reviews.Content: I stayed here despite some warnings about being out of the way. But I loved my room, it was one of the biggest I have had in Europe for the price. It had a good shower, balcony, living room, small kitchen. The staff was nice and helpful. The location was not too bad. Easy walk to Trastevere with tons of good restaurants and bars, and a nice old world feel to it. One block away from a tram stop. Quick taxi pick ups too and nice arrangements for taxis. I didn't eat the free breakfast as I was in too much of a hurry to have a coffee at an outdoor cafe

Reviews.Title: “Will return - good value hotel for Rome”
Reviews.Author: cat666999
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from Rome (and oh, how I miss it!), I was surprised to see the most recent review of this hotel. I thought it was good value. I think we paid about £115 a night and I certainly remember it being one of the cheaper options in Rome (whilst still in a nice area). We had a huge room which was separated into a bedroom and a kitchenette/dinner/lounge. There was also a balcony and a decent sized bathroom with a bath. The service was great - even the cleaners would smile and say hello to you. The room was clean, and our toiletries were topped up every day. I thought that the bed was comfortable and the towels were soft and clean smelling (i.e. not stinking of bleach!). There were some repair issues, for example a wonky shower rail, a bashed in cupboard door. I get the impression that the hotel is being updated bit by bit as I know that there are nicer rooms, but I don't know that for certain. Presumably there wouldn't be any point in making any unnecessary repairs if the whole lot is going to get pulled out at some point. My criticisms are that the breakfasts were really not good. The coffee came from a machine and just was not right. We were in Italy it was wrong! Thankfully, they did have earl grey!! The food wasn't up to much either, but there were lots of bars around where we could pick something up, so it wasn't a problem. In fact, wherever we stay, we generally end up having breakfast out. There are still the repair issues as mentioned before. Essentially this is in a great location - Trastervere is a great place to stay, the hotel is clean, the staff are really friendly and helpful, it's good value and you get a decent size room. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Tale of Two Hotels”
Reviews.Author: boston_tripadviser
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at the Ripa recently and had two very different experiences based on the room I was given. As a background, I booked my stay via hotels.com at an incredibly low $120 a night (Rome in September tends to be rather expensive). Upon checking in, I was given room 119, which is on the first floor and looked like a 1970 East German idea of a cool room. Weird IKEA type decor in a very oddly set-up room. Large enough, but not very functional and rather dark and dingy. Not the kind of carpet I would want to walk on with bare feet. The bed was worst, since I was able to feel each worn out spring. The room was also really close to the elevator and service room, so it got loud very early in the morning. I believe this room is reserved for low-rate bookings via discount sites. Based on this room, it would be a two star rating at best. Upon speaking to the front desk, I was eventually given a different room (#218), which turned out to be 100% better. Much larger (pretty much a junior suite) with a small balcony and a foam mattress bed which was very comfortable. The room even had a small kitchen and the bathroom had better fixtures. It was also very quite. I felt as though I had checked into a different hotel. This was more like a 3.5 star room. Overall, the hotel is in a perfect location right in the middle of Trastevere, which is probably one of the more beautiful areas in Rome. The trolley is a few minutes from the hotel and goes straight into Rome. It also goes to the Trastevere rail station, which will take you to the airport in about 25 minutes for 5.50 Euros. Great deal and very convenient. The rooms have tiny TVs with lots of international stations. Both rooms had safes and desks with two chairs. The breakfast was included and decent enough, though mainly low quality prefab pastries and such. Internet was not included and is extremely expensive (about 25 Euros a day). All hotel services seemed outrageously priced and should be avoided. All in all, your experience will greatly depend on the type room you get. I would try to avoid the first floor altogether and request a room with balcony. If you get a decent room, it's a perfect place to explore beautiful Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely worth of money!”
Reviews.Author: Hmek
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews in the Internet, I was a bit concerned about the level of the Ripa Hotel as we already had paid our rooms. Luckily from the arrival everything well more than perfectly; the staff was always very helpful, corteous and friendly. They did their best to help us with all the problems we had. They took care of our taxi reservation, gave us tips how to get around with the public transport etc. Our room type was "executive" so I don't know how were the other rooms but at least ours was very clean, classic Scandinavian style and the room service always cleaned the room very well although we spent 8 days there. Nothing was broken in our room and the room seemed to be quite new. The rooms have minibar, a small balcony or terrace, safety box. For the Internet (also in the public areas) you need to pay. The hotel is situated in Trastevere, near the tram 8 so it is very easy to get around with the public transport, also by buses. In Trastevere you can find very good restaurants with good service and moderate price level. We definitely recommend the restaurants! You can also find some nice shops there. The breakfast was very good, perhaps not so luxurious as I had thought on the basis of the previous reviews but in Finland the hotel breakfast is something overwhelming, so I would say that in the European level the breakfast was excellent. A wonderful surprise was that one evening the staff had brought us sparkling wine and chocolate to our room as my mum celebrated her birthday! A wonderful gesture towards a traveler although for the hotel it does not cost too much, I think. What a nice way to surprise! In general I can warmly recommend Ripa Hotel for the people who appreciate good service, Scandinavian / modern style of a hotel and clean rooms. And if you have any doubts before your trip, please contact the hotel personnel, it is easy to get in contact with them. At least I felt that they really wanted to make the best of our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Ripa Hotel - Perfect and Unforgettable Stay!”
Reviews.Author: brooklynbuba
Reviews.Content: I have travelled a lot and stayed in hundreds of hotels all over the world, but recently I had the pleasure of staying in a fantastic hotel while I was on vacation in Rome. I stayed at the Ripa Hotel. The room was extremely comfortable and quiet. Actually the room was really the size of a suite, but the price was the price of a standard room! There were many amazing features such as an enormous WALK IN CLOSET, ample storage space throughout, an extremely comfortable bed, black out shades, central air conditioning that worked (I have stayed in many hotels in Italy where it didnt, or worked very poorly), and an enormous balcony. The staff was great, warm and attentive, and very efficient. Breakfast was included in the rate and it was a full breakfast - it was an enormous breakfast that kept me full all day. The Ripa hotel is located in Trastevere, which is the part of Rome I would consider the "real rome" - authentic, where Romans hang out and dine.
