Its a quick walk to everything, but the nice part is that its on a quiet side street so you can get good rest as well. I slept like a baby in this hotel! I would definitely recommend it to anyone going to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: sazmonkey
Reviews.Content: We went to rome in april and it was the perfect time, not too warm or swarming with crowds. the hotel was wonderful, rooms were minimalistic, clean and very comfortable. The staff were ace. On my bitrhday the left a bottle of champagne in the room! And the breakfast buffet was great to chow down to before the start of the day. The location was very good as well, in the Trastevere area with plenty of restaurants and the centre being an easy tram or bus ride away

Reviews.Title: “Over-esteemed boutique -- Great location”
Reviews.Author: canopyboy
Reviews.Content: The Ripa hotel moonlights as a boutique hotel, but unless you are one of the lucky guests who get the suite pictured on their promo photos (if it indeed exists), your experience will be that of a standard aparthotel. Upon first entering the lobby area is surely has the feel of a trendy up and coming place tucked away in the history-rich Trastavere neighborhood of Rome, but when you get beyond the ground floor....the true nature of the hotel is revealed as little more than a furnished apartment building with the same musty carpet and upholstery of its renting days. Apart from its misinformed title, the place is certainly comfortable as a standard room with its extra-space and extended kitchen area. The location is unbeatable for its class as it is within walking distance to many attractions and restaurants, and also a block away from free public transportation going to all areas of the city. If you decide to book this hotel, consider the price on basis of location....not for the promise of a boutique-class accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: iomboi
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay at the hotel ripa, attention to detail amazing rooms restaurant was gorgeous also the food was unbelievable from brakfast to tea amazing. I was there for my birthday and the manager sent champagne to my room which was a lovely touch with a note saying thatk you for chosing to spend this special occasion with them. Not saying everyone will get champagne i dont know. Staff brilliant couldn't do enough for you. rooms spacious, well equipted. close to shops and rail connections. this realy as a fantastic holiday thank you hotel ripa.

Reviews.Title: “Good Affordable Option for Trastevere”
Reviews.Author: rkade32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ripa Hotel for 2 nights because we wanted to be close to Trastevere (fun area in Rome with great restaurants and nightlife), and the hotel is only a 5-10 minute walk from all of that. The rooms themselves are very clean, spacious, and have great air conditioning. They are too modern for my taste, but we got a great deal through the website (69 euro/night not including breakfast) and we weren't looking to spend much time in the room anyway. If you are looking for a clean and spacious room next to the heart of Trastevere, I would recommend Ripa.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: ianp4
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from spending three nights at Hotel Ripa and I'm full of praise for it and the staff. Having been to Rome of a few previous occasions I would say that this hotel offers superb value for money. The location is ideal, far enough away from the centre not to be too busy, or overpriced but close enough to either walk or get a tram to the sites. It is very close to Trastevre, which is great for drinks and eating out. It is also very easily accessible from Fumicino airport. The room I stayed in was an executive room and was very nice with all the facilities as promised and in very good and clean condition. The attitude of the staff was also excellent. All the staff I saw spoke English which was useful for me as my Italian is rusty at best (I think I also overheard staff speaking Spanish and German too) and they all appeared keen to help. I will be booking to return soon. On another note, I admit I have an advantage as I have been to the city before and the directions may have been updated on the website but I had no problems finding the hotel by tram from Trastevre station.

Reviews.Title: “fashion hotel”
Reviews.Author: hug91
Reviews.Content: nice but old fashion hotel, very good position for nightlife

Reviews.Title: “The Rooms were not as expected!!!”
Reviews.Author: SenayLondon
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel has a nice design in the breakfast area and the staircase is probably the best feature of the hotel. Also, the location is great because you can avoid getting a taxi from the airport and instead get the rail from the airport for just over 5 Euros bringing you to Trastevere which you can then just jump on the number 8 tram opposite and get off the third stop. The hotel is on your right when you get off the tram and that same tram will take you to the city centre where all the main attractions are in walking distances. The hotel room is not of a 4* standard, the beds are hard and everytime you turn it felt like you were gonna break the bed. There is no natural sunlight coming through the windows and the room is divided with wardrobes fitted right in the middlle. The bath was probably better and the powerful showers would always wake you up in the mornings to get ready for the beauiful city. I always looked forward to the breakfast which was the same everyday but kept you full and saved you a bit of money which was great!!! This hotel has a great location but cannot be the best in terms of full comfort and quality furniture in your rooms..some might say the rooms are tacky but if you go there for the city then who cares we only slept there and the rest was about exploring the city!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs some maintenance”
Reviews.Author: SilviaMona
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, just a couple of minutes from the Trastevere cable-car taking you to the center of Rome. Overall, the hotel is not bad, but surely the room we were given can by no way be compared with the pictures shown on the website. This is what happens usually, but the Ripa is supposed to be a 4-star hotel, and the rooms have nothing to do with a 4-star hotel. Our room was big enough, but probably it was renovated last time 20 years ago (most electrinicy socket were broken, the sink was leaking and the furniture need to be fixed). Breakfast offered a wide range of food (pastries, cereals, yogurts, sausages…) but the quality was far from high. I would not recommend it for people expecting to stay in a proper 4-star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great design - Needs some maintenance”
Reviews.Author: CarlitosM
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at the Ripa (August 08). The previous time was in July 06. Obviously we returned because we had liked the hotel. But we did find the hotel in a bit of a worse shape than our previous visit. As other reviewes say, the first time it took us a little to find the hotel, and the view from the windows is not very romantic, as you see other apartment buildings. We did find the overall location convenient to the nearby tram, which takes you right into the Centro Storico, and across the tram to Trastevere. So both times we came in a car, and parked the car for our whole stay. We stayed for 3 nights. The whole hotel has a good design theme, which will appeal to Wallpaper style aficionados. (It's actually featured in the Rome guide). The rooms, the lobby, the breakfast area have a consistent style. The unfortunate aspect, is that some details like paint, or cables visible, or loose fittings make you forget about what otherwise would be a perfect stay. The bathroom in our room was a sample of this. The breakfast was good, but nothing out of the ordinary. We got good attention from the staff and didn't find them neither rude nor super friendly.

Reviews.Title: “No, thanks.”
Reviews.Author: g0ne
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March 2008 and was very disappointed with the hotel. We stayed in a essential room which was not refurbished. The heating did not work, we had a hole in the front door, wires hanging out where electrical works should be and there were holes in the bathroom wall.

Reviews.Title: “Ripa Hotel Design was nice”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl5099
Reviews.Content: Initally the hotel was difficult to find. I took the train from Roma Termini to Trastevere station, but from there the bus route dumped me in the rain at an intersection for which I had no clue how to get to the hotel. I hailed a taxi and he chuckled and said oh yes, I know where it is and proceeded to take back roads and I arrived at the hotel with a 3.45 euros ride. I was close, but the maps were not helpful. I was happy with the room, however, the restaurant did not offer much. I was the only customer in it at 14:00 so that was a hint. Also, 25 euros for wireless for 24 hours? In the US and other hotels in Europe, wireless if free to business travelers. The staff was helpful and curtious, no complaints there. The Ripa should have a shuttle service....to the Roma Termini. To get to the Fiumicino airport, I had to take a bus, then a local train from Trastevere station to Roma Termini, and then the train to the Airport...hauling two pieces of luggage on and off the entire way. I can do that, but there are many travellers who cannot. A taxi to the airport was 75euros.

Reviews.Title: “Time to standardize the "boutique" label”
Reviews.Author: Weaverbird
Reviews.Content: Quirky hotel in the far south side of the Trastevere district. Looks like a standard appartment house (and a boring one) from the outside, but quite cool inside. The majority of the staff do their best to stay with the decoration, ie cool and unfortunately not too friendly. Do spend the money on a better than standard room, as some of the standard rooms are really really bad. The one we got on arrival was pretty much an unpainted, not refurbished appartment: fully equipped with kitchen and somebody's old couch. Having made a big fuzz about it, they switched us but only at a charge. All in all the neighbourhood is ok, the hotel is ok, but you can do much better for this kind of money in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cheezel
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Ripa Hotel. The location is close to good convenient transport and to the interesting and lovely old area. Breakfast breakfast selection was good.

Reviews.Title: “Rather liked the Ripa!”
Reviews.Author: lou25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Ripa for ten nights in August and had a great time. Yes there are elements to the hotel that need some attention, but this did not detract from what was a very pleasant stay. Situated in the Trastevere area of Rome, the hotel is within easy access of the centre of the city, owing to the fact that it is directly across from the tram stop, which gets you into the heart of Rome in less than ten minutes. Those who claim that it is miles away from the sights must obviously be unaware of this! We found the staff to be very pleasant and welcoming and always eager to help with any questions or requests that we had. The hotel’s communal areas had a very modern feel, the breakfast room being very light, with quirky shaped walls and there is an unusual stairwell which leads to all floors. Our room was on the sixth floor and had a separate bedroom area, two comfy sofas, a built-in kitchen area, dining table and a good sized balcony overlooking a quiet residential area and of course the necessary air conditioning. Our bathroom, although starting to show some signs of wear, was clean and was constantly supplied with fresh towels and complimentary toiletries, likewise our linen was changed every day. The hotel offers a good selection for breakfast, with the usual offerings of cereals, pastries, cheeses and meats, as well as eggs, bacon and a fine selection of fruit juices and coffee. Within a short stroll of the hotel you can find a vast array of wonderful restaurants to enjoy the delights of Italian cuisine and it is also close to the Tiber, the banks of which come alive at night. The Trastevere area is a breath of fresh air from the often crowded streets of the city centre, and it is here where many Romans will choose to eat, as the prices can be significantly less than the more touristy areas, but the quality very good. We certainly enjoyed our stay at the Ripa Hotel and whilst we can accept that some areas of the hotel could do with a touch up, many of the issues raised by other reviewers are somewhat unfounded and we would certainly choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Ripa”
Reviews.Author: FreddyG
Reviews.Content: After reading a lot of negative reviews on this hotel I was very worried about what to expect. I wasn't worried about the location as we had stayed in the Trastevere district before and like this part of Rome after a days sight seeing. However, my concerns over the hotel quickly evaporated. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was spacious, very clean, comfortable beds with loverly clean white bedding. We had a fridge/mini bar, which is useful if you use the supermarket just a block up the road. The bath room was clean and spacious with good lighting. The balcony doesn't have much of a view, but I expected this in a city centre hotel. My only criticism is as the hotel is surrounded by other buildings and it can be dull in the rooms due to the lack of direct sunlight. The breakfast room was very bright and modern and the selection of food was very good (including bucks fizz some hot selections and a good cold buffet). The No. 8 tram stop is only a couple of minutes walk away and brings you directly into the centre of Rome. If you wanted to walk in it's 30 minutes along the river to the Vatican or 20 minutes over the River to Circus Maximus and the Colosseum. All in all we enjoyed our stay here and would definitely recommend it for a few days sightseeing and for the price we paid, which for less than £100 per night for a triple room in Rome is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - why all the bad reviews??”
Reviews.Author: Brighteyes61
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews, eg The Grim Reaper, and the fact that I am petrified of spiders (see other reviews), to say I was worried about staying here is a grand under-statement. We arrived in Trastevere station later than expected and found ourselves roaming the streets around midnight looking for the hotel - it is off the main road om the right after a 20 minutes walk from the station (roundabout in side street on the right), and about 100 yards on the left (just down the road from some sort of factory also on the left.). The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful on arrival, the room was excellent. Okay, the view was of apartments opposite but we didn't expect to be overlooking St Peters or the Spanish Steps. Breakfast was more than adequate, room was cleaned every day, the cafe bar never appears to be open (but so what when in 5 minutes you have Trastevere and it's delightful restaurants and ice cream shops), and THERE WAS NOT A SPIDER IN SIGHT.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: leona1983
Reviews.Content: after reading reviews on this hotel i was serioulsy considering cancelling and booking somwhere else. but when we arrived i'm gald we didnt. some reviews were really nit picking. on arrival, i thought the reception was very mod, receptionist was lovely. got room 626 i think and it was very big. had a fridge, cooker,sink, seperate living area and balcony. plenty of wardrobe space. the only thing is the lighting is kinda poor but thats only minor in my opinion. didnt really bother me. had great nights sleep for the 4 night we were there. the tram stop is only a 2 min walk away and brings you directly into the centre of rome so the location is perfect. if you wanted to walk in it'd only take you 20-30 mins so its not that far. all in all we enjoyed our stay here and would definitely recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Only so-so”
Reviews.Author: Kurosaki_Ichigo
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Ripa Hotel was the Trastevere neighborhood, which was filled with excellent restaurants and bars. However, the absence of a nearby metro station meant that a first-time visitor to Rome like my partner and I wound up taking a cab back to the hotel most of the time, particularly given the oppressive Roman heat. The hotel was nicely designed and decorated. The breakfast area was quite cool. The breakfast buffet was quite nice, although it got monotonous after 4 days. The room itself was nice and spacious, although I did have some problems with the leaky bathtub that seeped into the carpet in the main room. The housekeeping was also negligent in replacing the toiletries. Also wished the hotel staff could have been less gruff.

Reviews.Title: “A tricky and poor 2 stars hotel. Un timo, no vayas!”
Reviews.Author: Madrilenos
Reviews.Content: Nothing related with a 4 star hotel, but closer to a 2 stars. Most of the rooms they have are not even similar to those you can see in their web page. We had to claim two times for getting a "normal room". The location, although in the Trastevere is not very good, it is in a quite isolated area. Very old and dirty building. Poor breakfast, very ungry people at the front desk And we only paid 155€!!! Tricky hotel! A scam of a hotel, look for another one!

Reviews.Title: “Liked this hotel a lot”
Reviews.Author: HarrietLongIsland
Reviews.Content: My stay here was a positive one. The Front Desk staff was extremely helpful, calling cabs for me whenever necessary, answering questions, providing umbrellas, etc. The only negatives which I hope the Management would think about correcting are the following, all having to do with the bathroom: (1) There are no hooks in the bathroom to hang towels, robes, clothing, etc. (2) The lighting in the bathroom is too dim; although it looks "chic", we really need more bright, direct light when washing, shaving, applying make-up, etc. (3) There should be more counter-space for toiletries. (4) A wash-cloth should be provided for the shower That being said, my room, which was at the end of the hallway, was totally quiet and very comfortable. Sure the rooms could use a fresh paint-job, but they seemed clean enough. The location for me was wonderful. Just out-of-the-way enough to be quiet yet close enough to the center of the city. And the breakfast dining room and buffet are excellent. Again, great, friendly staff. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel, negative criticism unjustified”
Reviews.Author: nonamewilldo
Reviews.Content: Having been surprised to see so many negative reviews about the Ripa Hotel I felt compelled to write about my own overall positive impressions of the place. It's a fine hotel, maybe not the same 4-star standard one might expect elsewhere in Europe, but it's clean, the rooms are comfortable and spacious, and we found the staff very friendly and helpful. The hotel has a sort of art nouveau thing going on, and its internal layout is certainly very interesting. On the downside, it is not centrally located and you will need to avail of public transport to visit most of Rome's attractions from the hotel (however its location in Trastevere puts Ripa in close proximity to several good restaurants and the laid back Roman nightlife). Also, the hotel is difficult to find. It's located two blocks back from the main street, and the website directions for customers coming from Ciampino Airport are misleading; you should go RIGHT, not left, at the votive candles after getting off the bus. You can avail of a good buffet breakfast but can't use trays to collect your food, which can cause frustrating congestion as people walk over and back bringing food to their table. Overall though, we were quite happy with the Ripa Hotel. I think the reviewers that slammed it were expecting too much from the 4-star rating. It's no Ritz Carlton, but it serves its purpose as a comfortable, hospitable place from which to explore the Eternal City.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but dont expect 4star”
Reviews.Author: Travelling-Eli
Reviews.Content: This hotel is stated as a four star venue but on arriving here you can see from the outside that it is going to fall somewhat short of this. Ths facade is crumbling (and not in a good old-world way) with missing render and plaster on most balconies. Check in was very smooth and the staff very helpful. Our room, a suite with a balcony was, on first impressions, very well presented but it didn't take long to see through this veneer. Firstly, the large room is sectioned off to give a private 'bedroom area' with fitted wardrobes. this is probably a design feaure for those using the room as a a family suite but it left the bedroom slightly too small. The rest of the room which had a small concealed kitchen area and a seating area we seldom used at all. The balcony was a nice touch for some fresh air. Attention to detail would have made this hotel experience a whole lot better. the light switch panels kept falling off, the door architrave was ill-fitting and unfinished and the over-bath shower was so ill-fitting that water ran down the wall and into the holes behind the taps. The hotel is huge yet you never feel that it is crammed. There is ample space at breakfast and we never felt rushed. Breakfast was good enough - buffet style. The hotel is ok and at some of the deal prices is a good place to stay. One feels anonymous enough to come and go as one pleases yet all staff are friendly. Trastevere is certainly the place to stay and this hotel is situated well for the local bars and restaurants. We found that eating in Trastevere was cheaper and better quality than across the Tiber and the mingle of busy thin streets are very romantic with something aorund the next corner for everyone. Bars here are good too. The tram system takes one to very near this hotel (a number 8 from Argentina) and the public transport system is a great way to get around and save your feet. (One last thing before you go to rome. I would advise against using the fast Terravision bus service from the airport. they tell you that this is frequent but it is at the companies discretion and they can pull services whenever they like. we were standed in Rome on our return and had to pay out to another service to get to our flight in time. ) On the whole this hotel was reasonably good and very clean but dont expect it to be 4 star. it's 3star at best.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: femmedeclavier
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ripa is a super place to stay if you want a real Roman neighborhood away from the touristy-commercial area. Yet, tranportation to the sights is very convenient. We enjoyed the small local eateries and piazzas in Trastevare. The hotel personnel is very friendly and accommodating. If you don't like "Italian modern" you won't like the decor. We found it quite refreshing after spending the day in the "over-the top" baroque churches and Greco-Roman style ruins. The breakfast offerings kept hunger at bay for most of the day. The rooms are actually little suites, much larger than the typical European hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel "Grim" Ripa”
Reviews.Author: LondonTeapot
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were prepared for ugliness of the hotel in terms of its immediate surroundings, and we were not surprised when we approached a smartish-looking front to the hotel, but overlooking a carpark and rough tenement buildings. The only plus point is that it is very near Trastervere and also nearby for trams. On first inspection the room looked very hi-spec, using a minimalist/modern design. However, on closer inspection we were very disappointed to find that the rooms had been designed with more attention to a superficial sense of style rather than substance and quality. (poorly finished) All the furnishings and decorations are cheap in terms of their quality. We could not fully unpack because only one rail with hangers is provided. There is no wardrobe or drawer space in the room. Almost everything in the weenie bathroom was disfunctional. (No hooks to hang anything on. No surfaces to put anything on. Bath was pitch black and leaked. Toilet was wonky and wobbly) We asked to be moved as when I picked up the phone, a multitude of spiders ran out from under the ear piece. We were moved to an identical room (even same damp patches on outer wall due to there being no tiles around the bath. Also, there was the same ugly view of a decaying tenement block opposite window. Same family of spiders - this time invading the bathroom and bath.) We did complain about the spiders, but were not given any solution. The longer you stay in the hotel, the more you realise how poorly designed it is. You are given one key for the room with a massive key fob which had to be returned to reception each time you left the hotel (not two swipe cards as you would expect). In order to turn on the power for the room you must plug the key in. However, because the lighting in the corridor is so bad, you are in pitch blackness as you search for a tiny slot in which to insert you key. This is ideal after several glasses of wine! The gym is only a treadmill and bike with a few weights. You have to book it as only one person can use it at a time. However, noone else was interested and I got the use of it whenever I wanted which was very convienient. The staff (apart from lack spider solution business) were very friendly. The breakfast was not worth going down for since the nearby Trastevere Cafe does an excellent cappucino and croissant for about a pound. This is NOT a four star hotel. I don't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Met all our requirements”
Reviews.Author: JulesCheltenham
Reviews.Content: I and few of my girlfriends from work decided we wanted a cheap but short weekend break away and we weren't disappointed. Not only was the city of Rome amazingly beautiful but The Ripa hotel met all of our requirements and was a very pleasant and comfortable place to stay. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was lovely and had a decent variety of foods plus good coffee to wake you up! The local transports links were excellent so you could get into the centre of town within a few mins by tram. Rooms clean, spacious and comfortable. There was a nice sofa/lounge area where we could relax and have a drink after our hard day sightseeing. Therefore, I have no idea why the other trip reviewers on here did not have a nice stay unless maybe there are used to staying in more pricey and posh hotels. But as far as we were concerned The Ripa offered us everything we would expect from overnight accommodation.There was absolutely nothing wrong with it! So please don't be put off by the other reviewers on here. Cheers. Julie

Reviews.Title: “No going back”
Reviews.Author: ripaoffed
Reviews.Content: Definitely not a 4-star hotel - the breakfast was NOT worthy of 2 star at best, - the bathroom was comparative to a upmarket hostel, - no face cloth, very tired towels - shower curtain not expected in a 4 star hotel - TV was pretty ancient - the location was not one expected for a 4 star - plaster cracked and falling off the roof in our bedroom - bathroom accessories were kitchen towel stylie- never quitre figured out if those supplied were a furniture cloth or a dish cloth. I mentioned the lake post-shower, and was assured the manager would atend to it. When I checked out - not a mention. The only saving factor was the location for good local restaurants. Some staff were helpful. Not a nice introduction to Roma. Definitely wont go back.

Reviews.Title: “Ripa Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: sambagrrl07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ripa for one night on our way back to New York, after a wonderful apartment stay in Rome and hotel stay in Naples. Alas, this was NOT a good way to end our trip as we were singularly unimpressed with the Ripa. It was the one place we stayed the whole time that we didn't like, and it was also the most expensive. The staff are officious and kept trying to get tips out of us when we checked in (with our rolling bags we did NOT need help getting to our room). We were upgraded (with no explanation) to what must have been a suite of some kind as it had a small kitchen, a sofabed, and a balcony, but the room was in very bad shape. Perhaps when the hotel first opened it looked modern and cutting-edge, but the lighting was inadequate, the laminated furnishings had seen better days, and the couch was mushier than anything I'd been on in a Motel 6. The king bed (actually two twins pushed together) was comfortable and the bathroom nicely furnished -- wonder of wonders, a bathtub! -- but that was about it. As a place to crash before getting up at the crack of dawn for our flight back to New York, it served its purpose. We were able to take the #8 tram from the hotel to Trastevere station and take a local train from there to Fiumicino.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel........”
Reviews.Author: CarlyJo26
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Rome. My boyfriend and I went for a city break and stayed in the hotel Ripa. I had read a few reviews before we went to wasnt really sure what to expect.... but please dont be put off by the bad reviews because we really had nothing bad to say....The only thing that let the hotel down (just a little) was the breakfast area was a little crammed (but October is a very busy time)I admit that from the outside the hotel doesnt look the best, but what does that matter!! Its great inside, although it has a funky and modern feel it is really friendly and welcoming too. The staff were wonderful, they gave us lots of advice on the area and transportation. The hotel is about 5-10 minutes walk from a square that has lots of resturaunts and wine bars.You could possibly walk to the attractions of Rome but with so much to do I wouldnt recommend it. We walked over the bridge to the centre of Rome and then got on a tour bus which was a great way of seeing all of the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: TrailerBlazer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful time. The staff at the hotel and at the cafe treated us like family and bent over backwards to ensure that we had a good time. They recommended excellent local restaurants and were very helpful guiding us through the tram and bus lines. I had coffee with Mr. Roscioli at the cafe and I feel like I made a friend. I only wish I could have sat down and had a drink with some of the staff. Everyone was charming. It was a pleasure. Jeffry Peleg Fort Lauderdale, FL

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but lacks that something extra”
Reviews.Author: MintTea
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel in early October. The first thing you notice about the hotel is the location. It is not immediately easy to find the hotel, situated down a side street that's surrounded by derelict looking buildings and some dubious characters hanging around. However, you'll soon realise that the location has good connections to all the sights in Rome - via the tram and the various bus services. We had a room on the 5th floor. The room was large with contemporary styling, however I felt that although it was trying very hard to be chic there was something missing. The small balcony faced a shabby building and there was little room in the bathroom to place your toiletries. Breakfast was a simple affair of bread, meat and cheese but was enough to set you up for the day ahead. There was also a supermarket next to the hotel for other supplies. The area also had several pizzerias which will give you pizza to take away if you ask nicely! Overall, I can't really complain about the hotel and it is very convenient for sight-seeing, perhaps if the immediate area was regenerated then it might have more wow-factor.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great, Detinately Not A 4*, Wouldn't Recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Hopwoodc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights (Sep 13th, 14th, 15th) and would DEFINITELY NOT return or recommend! I stay boutique, modern and contemporary hotels across the globe and this certainly isn't one of them. Spend your hard earned cash on a better 3* for less money. What a shame... this could have been be a decent 4* hotel, but sadly the designer and architect lack any real flair and imagination, the management have scrimped and saved on the pennies and what you end up with is a poor 3* hotel (certainly NOT a modern, contemporary boutique hotel). Location - I'd describe it as the 'Hoxton' of London - up and coming, earthy and urban and full of young people. The area itself feels vibrant, and this is were all the young people hang out in the evening (some great restaurants and bars near by) and a short tram ride into the centre. HOWEVER the hotel looks like a disused office block and my room/s over looked a disused building. Down and outs live round the corner to the hotel and urinate in front of you (nice). Graffiti dons most of the near by walls. The area is pretty noisy - car alarms woke us up most mornings at 7am and we were kept awake until 4am by shouting in the street. if you are a light sleeper you won't get much rest here. Rooms - nothing like the photo's! Interestingly enough as we checked in there was a photographer in shooting photo's and they had shipped a load of new furniture - this was removed when the shoot was finished (so be warned.... it's nothing like the website)! This hotel and the rooms look like a cheap version of an Ikea catalogue but without the flair or style (if you can credit Ikea with that). The rooms are large, however, why on earth they feel the need to give half the floor space to a cheap sofa (when we sat on it we feel to the ground and it was stained and tired) and kitchen area I don't know. The bed itself was surrounded by wardrobes so no natural light or fresh air could enter the room - it felt dark and stuffy. The designer has lacked any style and imagination (they've tried to be trendy but failed miserably). We were given room 213 - tired and dirty with remnants of the previous guests still under the bed. When you used the 'make shift' shower it flooded the entire room so we asked to move. We were given the same room (614) on a different floor which was the same as the previous. Both rooms had a balcony which looked out onto a disused building. The air conditioning wasn't great so the room was generally very hot and uncomfortable. The toiletries provided were cheap and nasty. The walls are so thin I could hear every word from the room next door (including them taking clothes out of the wardrobe). Breakfast - the standard Italian breakfast by European stands is poor but this was even worse! The chief lacks any imagination and was the same poor, boring stuff every day. Not even fresh juice provided - some watered down drink alternative. Tea and coffee out of a flask, a bit of ham, cold cooked bacon swimming in fat, cheese, stale bread and tinned peaches was the only prepared fruit. There was a bit of fresh fruit on a stand but it was all under ripe and to be honest having paid 200 euros a night it would have been nice if the kitchen could be bothered to chop it up! MTV blasting in the corner so you couldn't hear yourself think and not enough staff to clear all the dirty tables as you were herded in and out like cattle. The staff - my corporate travel agent phoned them up to get me a booking and they were apparently full and wanted to charge more than the advertised rate on the website. However the website allowed me to book (very strange). we were warmly welcomed, but don't bother asking for directions as they are more than likely to be incorrect (as we found on 2 occasions). We did ask to be moved as our first room was so poor and we were however we were put in something just as poor as the first. I had the feeling the staff are embarrassed that your being ripped off with such a poor offering. I asked for an iron to be sent to my room and they didn't have one in the whole hotel (although i could pay 5 euros a pop for them to do it on site). This hotel is very poor - don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Sarah2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights for our first ever trip to Italy. After reading the reviews we were pleasantly surprised as we were not expecting much. I do think the positives outweigh the negatives. When we arrived the receptionist was very friendly & advised us that we had been upgraded. Our room was nice & modern with unusual decor. The balcony was a bonus. Here are a list of the positives & negatives that we experienced: Positives: - Nice Staff - Good breakfast - reasonable room rate through hotel website approx 120 euro per night - Close to tram & bus stop - very good coffee in the Cafe Negatives: - Area just outside the hotel is not nice, building site & homeless people nearby - Hotel could do with some touch ups & also some art work / flowers to brighten up the place. The area Trastevere is very good for dining out if you are interested in eating in authentic Italian restaurants. Ai Marmi & Da Augusta are 2 such restaurants which we ate in & found them to be lively, full of italians & serving delicious & inexpensive authentic italian food. I would not recommend this hotel if you want to be in an upmarket area beside the tourist attractions. We found this hotel to be very satisfactory & would probably return again.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MGlaessel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September last year and would definately not come back. The rooms are generally spaciouse but in dire need of repairs with holes in the walls and wires hanging from the ceiling. Also the view was onto a delapedated office building. The hotel itself is not very central, surrounded by dirty streets filled with homeless people. The staff was generally unhelpful and unfriendly and we were left to wait quiet often at reception when we asked for directions even when none of the staff had anything to do. One plus point was the breakfast which was plentiful with a lot of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Funky alternative in a real Roman neighborhood. What's all the fuss?”
Reviews.Author: DoctorLogistics
Reviews.Content: Granted that this isn't the most stylish boutique hotel in the world, but it does have character and the service was good. Our room looked EXACTLY like the website photos and we seemed to have a standard room, so either we get lucky or everyone else here is just a grouch. The exterior is nothing impressive but the rooms and lobby were nice. The area immediately surrounding the hotel is also nothing spectacular, however Trastevere in general is a GREAT place to stay. You avoid the tourist throngs of the center but it's only a short tram ride to Argentina, and Piaza Santa Maria is really happening at night. There was also a whole summertime festival set up alongside the river in the evening and in to the early morning hours. August is kind of dead in Rome since everyone leaves to go on holiday (well over more than half the shops are boarded up for 2-3 weeks), but if any Romans were still in town then they were partying in our neighborhood and we just loved it. We experienced absolutely no problems at this hotel. The service and facilities were both quite good, and the neighborhood alone would encourage me to return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Situated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: busy_body_traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Ripa in April of 2007. The front desk clerks were really nice and very helpful. The rooms appeared to be everything you see online. The morning breakfast was delicious and the american coffee was unbelievable. Very nice hotel in a quiet area. If you want to get to the attractions, you can take the "8" tram and it is 1 block from the hotel. The hotel was located in a great area for tourist. On Sunday's there is a huge flea market right outside the hotel. I suggest entering on the backside (near the market) so you can skip all the used items. On our first night we walked up the block looking for a place to eat and there were tons of people hanging out in the this one square, so we hung out there every night. There were vendors (jewelry, handbags souvenirs), restaurants, and bars all over the place in this square. So we would definitely stay at the Hotel Ripa again and a true recommendation for young couples.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: james025
Reviews.Content: Having booked this through Expedia, I got everything I expected and would love to go back there in the future! The negative reviews here are a mystery to me as I only have good things to say. From the welcome at reception from the manager (not a common site in large hotels) ,our luggace being taken up by the friendly porter who didnt mind we didnt have change to tip him, the breakfasts, the map we were given and the information they marked on it, help with buses & trams, the fact they provided a charger for our camera, the breakfasts and just the general friendly attitude of the staff. The room was superb - very large, comfortable, with all the ameneties you would expect. there was plenty storage space and they were clean. OK so the immediate area isnt that great but the hotel is perfect and a short walk from the main street and beautiful side streets and cafes. I simply dont understand reviews complaining about graffiti etc - this is everywhere in Italy, its just a common thing - different culture! As for the shower, granted I flooded the room too but only because I was stupid enough to do it, not through the fault of the hotel! This is definitely 5* in my opinion - great decor, great staff, great location! I hope the management read this and I give them and the staff my thanks!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE!!”
Reviews.Author: Flossykate
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay at the hotel. Trastevere area is lovely but the hotel was very disappointing. The building is awful, rooms were nothing like as shown on the website and were badly in need of a re-paint. Some members of staff were very polite and helpful, whilst a handful were just downright rude. After leaving I remembered that I had stupidly left my £400 camera in a draw in the room. I knew exactly where it was and there were a few other documents in there too. I immediately contacted the hotel from the airport and was advised that nobody had checked into the room yet. They said they were too busy to send someone up to the room to check. Finally on my third call they advised me that there was nothing in the drawer?????? Obviously, my advice for any people due to stay at the hotel would be to keep valuables locked in the safe and to check every part of the room before the leave as expensive items misteriously disappear!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Damdoum
Reviews.Content: We spend 3 nights at Ripa hotel. We got a very good price but I would like to say it is not a 4 stars hotel even they describe as one.The location is in the Trastevere area, very cute place, with small old charming streets and plenty of restaurants.The exterior of the building is very old, and not pretty at all.It is located just in front of a building in reconstruction. The lobby is ok, but looks like a fashionned hotel of 70's, same impression for the room The style of the hotel is very simple, basic I would say Checkin was OK, staff is fine, they do speak and understand english Breakfast is awful, no choice, even the bread was disgusting and I am not difficult for the food We got an upgrade, so the executive room we got was quite big, but the bathtube was leaking after every shower, told it to the staff but they did not care apparently So if you go in Roma to visit and leave the hotel early in the morning this place is fine but consider it as a 3 stars The hotel is located by foot 20minutes away from the city center (Colosseo...) You have a tram near the hotel but you can not go very far with it, or a bus to Termini So be aware you will have to walk a lot! Bedroom had also AC so fine to sleep if weather is hot (we got 32 degres)

Reviews.Title: “Ripa covers the basics”
Reviews.Author: thenighttripper
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay in Rome, at the Hotel Ripa. It is situated about 300m from Piazza Santa Maria and all the Trastevere's best restaurants and bars. The hotel itself it directly facing a decrepid uninhabited apartment block, which should be demolished. The hotel lobby is quite impressive (evenmore so than on the website), with very attentive, competent english speaking staff. We needed money changed on our last night (Sunday), but were too late. A very friendly receptionist went out of his way to contact another hotel - who could not help - then he changed as much as he could using the hotel petty cash. The elevators are quite small - not for the clostrophobic. We were on the 6th floor, with a decent sized bathroom, good water pressure from the shower, twin beds tight together (although I requested a double), sitting area with mini bar and self catering area neatly packed behind hinged doors. There was also a balcony with a view of the already mentioned apartment block. Our room was disappointing, as it was not up to the standard I was expecting having visited the hotel website. It was more like an office than a hotel room, and the colours used were dull and uninspiring, and a little grubby in areas. The room though was cleaned every morning - fresh towels and sheets. I would rate the lobby/ reception area as 4 star, but the rest of the hotel as three. The adjoining restaurant/ bar was expensive compared to the great restaurants and bars in the Trastevere area - which is possibly the best area to stay, and eat in Rome. Once you cross the Tiber and approach some of the major attractions, prices tended to be inflated. We decided to walk to the majority of attractons - which could be done with relative ease. We will definately return to Rome, and would stay in this area (a little closer to the Piazza Santa Maria) without doubt, but probably not at the Hotel Ripa.

Reviews.Title: “fantasticly comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: Llahsram
Reviews.Content: situated in Trastavere, the apparently bohemian part of Rome now favoured by the stars, the hotel is two minutes from the bus & tram routes into the city centre (10 mins), and only a short walk from an enormous number of cafes and trattoria of Trastavere. The rooms are odd in design, but quite large and with fantasticly comfortable beds. Air con a bit dodgy in our room but, otherwise, everything fine. Not bad value for money inwhat is a quite expensive European capital.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Jerrytrip
Reviews.Content: I had an exceptionally large suite on the 5th floor with a living room and bedroom. The bath was furnished with a large selection of soap, shampoo and moisturizers. I had a secure balcony on the fifth floor with a nice view. Rooms above the 3rd or forth floor may have a view. Not all rooms are large. Caution: The bath tub was very deep. This would be a serious hazard for an older person or one with mobility problems. Due to a few issues I could not give this room a first class rating - all are cosmetic issues (spots on the rug, a large hole in the wall in the bathroom). Otherwise it was a nice place to be. The dining room was very lovely and the breakfast food what I would call standard European - not what Americans would expect - but that is the part of traveling that is fun!

Reviews.Title: “H-O-R-R-I-B-L-E”
Reviews.Author: ScourerLoBo
Reviews.Content: I totally agree with the last review. Hotel Ripa is a TERRIBLE and it bears no resemblence to what you can find from the website. We had 3 travellers altogether for our stay, and were given a big room which has been furnished to a very low standard. Our room is a suite, i.e. comprising a living room & a bedroom. The carpet is hard and dirty, the kind you can find in your office. The sofa bed is slumpy and dirty -- with the thin wall and noisy tourists, I am sure no one could sleep long in that bed. The BATHROOM, which is another joke, has been cleverly built IN the bedroom instead of the living room, which means you have to disturb whoever in the bedroom everytime you need the loo. In general, I felt like staying in a youth hostel rather than a hotel, let alone a 'boutique hotel' as they advertised. Service was poor -- no room service, and you have to go downstair to buy your pot of hot tea. But afterall, you wouldnt expect room service to happen in a hostel, right? Location -- Quite far from the central, and since it's located in some grotty area, it's difficult to get taxi as well. I have to say don't believe whatever you read and see from their website because the pictures and descriptions are totally misconceiving. Don't go!

Reviews.Title: “not a business hotel; spotty at best for other travelers”
Reviews.Author: ama_4327
Reviews.Content: A group of 65 stayed at this hotel for a meeting, and, although the website implies that this hotel is appropriate for business, it is not. Computer access, when it worked, was only available in the lobby, where there is no private (or comfortable) place to sit. No public computers (although there is an internet point about 2 blocks away). Some rooms were air-conditioned; unfortunately, the main meeting room did not have air conditioning in May, which had to have gotten to a temperature of over 95F by the end of the day. No public bathrooms on the floor of the main meeting room (and only 2 available at all!) One of our "break-out" rooms was simply one of the larger hotel rooms -- complete with bed and bathroom -- with a bunch of chairs. As to the rooms themselves, no place to sit, except the bed. One room I stayed in had a nice balcony, but, since there were no chairs, you couldn't read or relax out on it. The showers all leaked onto the floor (no one in my group could figure out how to prevent getting a puddle of water on the floor.) For some of us, the keys wouldn't open our room doors, and we had to have the hotel staff send maintenance (we were all told that this was the first time this has ever happened!) There were some good things: the location is great. Staff was friendly, although not the most competent. I think they tried to make things work --they just weren't really up to the challenge of a "large" meeting. Lunch served at the hotel was very good. Overall, I would recommend the neighborhood (Trastevere), but not this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at Ripa Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kateoxford
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ripa for three nights for our annual weekend away without our children. We therefore had high expectations! The Ripa hotel is just south of the main restaurant and prominading heart of Trastavere in Rome, and as such is fantastically located both for getting in to the historical centre (one tram ride or a 30 minute saunter through a beautiful part of Rome) and also close to loads of great places to eat and spend an evening. We've visited Rome three time, and it's definitely been our favourite bit to stay in. The hotel does lack "kerb appeal" as the road it is on is not beautiful, and from the outside it's al a bit grey and drab. Once inside though, all transforms, with stylish, spacious, well appointed and comfortable rooms, a lobby area and central atrium that I loved, and a comfortable bar and restaurant. The staff were friendly and helpful, the Prosseco I had pre ordered was chilled to perfection in our room when I arrived, rooms were cleaned without fuss each day - service simply great. Breakfast was fine, apart from the lack of proper coffee which has been commented on elsewhere on this website. We do not like instant, and expect better when in Rome! Coffee aside, this was a great hotel, in a good location which we would happily return to when childminders permit. We also consider it to have been good value for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: DublinJohn
Reviews.Content: I went here for 5 nights with 7 of my friends.We were treated very well and any enquiries were dealt with promptly.Copies of our passport were needed for admittance to the match that we went over for and the hotel obliged straight away.The rooms are spacious and I used the sofa bed(my brother is a very loud snorer)which I found very comfortable.The shower does leak onto the floor,this is more a problem for the hotel,as it is causing dampness.The location is good,not too far from the sights and very near some late night drinks.The staff are very friendly,even if they found it hard to understand the Dublin accent

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: judgeblink
Reviews.Content: The Hotel itself has absolutely nothing to offer from the outside, quite an ugly looking apartment building and extremely difficult to find. The rooms have no view and there is quite a lot of barking from a nearby kennels. The surrounding area is quite rough, on sunday morning it was like a really really bad car boot sale outside the hotel. The rooms were excellent, it was really nicely decorated and some of us got quite large rooms or suites, overall we were all very impressed with the decor and cleanliness. Breakfast was awful, we had to ask what the scrambled eggs were as we were not sure, needless to say we did not touch them. We ate croissants and yoghurts and avoided everything else. Coffee was cold, there were no clean cups etc and we had to find our own, not a waiter in sight. Our biggest complaint of your stay was the hotel bar staff, one girl in particular. She overcharged us for our drinks and when we queried our change she started shouting at us. We handed back the change and asked for this to be re-checked, she finally came down to our table with the correct change BUT threw the change across the table at us. We asked for the manager and she told us that she was the manager!!. We went to reception and eventually found the "manager", he apologised for the error, after which he told us "it is a crap hotel and tomorrow is my last day"!!! The girl never apologised but continued to talk and point at us all night. She completely ruined our experience of Rome. We won't be going back and neither will any guest that was present in the bar that night.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Flossycat
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay in the Hotel Ripa. The staff were friendly and very helpful, even checking us in early in the day so we could make the best use of our time. Maps and directions to the main tourist areas were provided as well as advise on public transport systems. Our room was without a bathplug and one was provided immediately by the staff. Breakfast was very good. A couple of tips, the hotel does not provide an airport shuttle but will book a taxi to the airport for a fixed rate of 45 euros. The best way to get to and from the Ripa is by train to Trastevere station which is 5 euros 50 per person and the number 8 tram which runs up and down Trastevere every 5 mins 1 euro per ticket - validate your ticket on the tram. The hotel also does not have a spa as advertised. Also, if you want to sleep before 04.00 on a Friday or Saturday night ask for a quite room at the back of the hotel away from the disco. We were unfortunately awake for 1 night but were moved the day after at our request by the management who were very helpful. I would definately stay there again. The hotel is well placed for great eating places and bars.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: N.Cottee
Reviews.Content: I agree with the Review below , myself and my husband have just come back from a 3 night city break staying at the hotel Ripa , who from the minute we arrived could not do enough for us. The hotel was actually full and very busy due to a student exchange trip however the reception staff still checked us in with a smile and some banter, offered us details of what buses/ trams to catch and where the stopped in order to go to various different attractions around Rome , providing us with a detailed map of all bus stops and routes to walk in order to get to all the different areas within Rome. Also offering the possibility of and organised tour with a pick up from the hotel lobby and were happy sort all the arrangements for us. Our cases were then taken to our very spacious room and the porter explained how everything worked with a smile and chat. I have stayed in many hotels in my time and yes the lifts might be small and the hotel might be a bit loud ( show me a hotel that isn’t loud in Rome !!! ) but when the staff are friendly the rooms are very big, the restaurant offers good food and the hotel is clean I fail too see how you can say that the hotel is poor in standards and personally if a hotel needs a little lick of paint I am not going to let it spoil my trip ! Overall a very good hotel with very friendly staff, slightly out of the main area but trust me this is a blessing as you don’t get all the tourist noise, the tram stops right outside the hotel to take you to the main square costing 1euro and arrive every 3/5 minutes - I don’t think you could ask for much more, I would stay at the Ripa hotel time and time again.

Reviews.Title: “Can it be the same hotel?”
Reviews.Author: TerjeH
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 10 day trip to Rome, where we stayed at the Hotel Ripa. We were 3 adults, having 2 rooms. When I read the reviews on this site I understood little. Either the hotel has improved dramatically over the last few weeks, or the people writing the reviews should seriously consider to increase their medication. I have stayed 200 - 250 days in hotels all over the world in my job for the last 25 years, so I claim have have the ability to judge good from bad. Trastevere is a great area to stay in Rome. It is central, yet not so flooded with the hordes of tourists as the areas across the river. Sure it's not the most pictoresque part of Rome, it's more a paralell to Berlin's Kreuzberg, but it is real and lively with good restaurants and nice bars. Campo di Fiori on the other side of the river is just a 20 minute walk away, and public transportation is good if you want to save your legs for a long day of sight seeing. The Hotel Ripa is a very good hotel, nicely located, well run and very comfortable. Sure they have their share of the loud, obnoxious Americans that pester every hotel in every major city in Europe, as well as their share of middle age British couples constantly complaining that things are different from home, or from the hotel in Brighton where they have spent their summer holidays since 1972, but I think it's a tad unfair to blame the hotel for that. The rooms are spacious, comfortable, quiet (something I appreciate a lot, being a very light sleeper) and clean. The staff, from the front desk to the bartenders, are friendly, professional and service minded. The breakfast is good, so is the restaurant. The hotel bar is a nice place to have a coffee while planning the days program, or have a little night cap on the way home. All in all we are very happy with our experience at Ripa, gives excellent value for money and we will certainly use it again. We will also recommen it to our friends

Reviews.Title: “Good-looking hotel, badly managed”
Reviews.Author: annagolightly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ripa hotel around Christmas 2006. We loved the location, in Trastevere with its beautiful churches and great restaurants, just a tramride away from the city centre. We also liked our calm and spacious room on the 4th floor (except the 'wardrobe', a clothes rack with only 6 metal hangers, sharp enough to cut your clothes and fingers on), and the overall design of the hotel. All light and bathroom fixtures were fully functional, so no problems there. However, the hotel management has some serious problems: breakfast was every bit as hideous as described in other reviews, disgusting coffee and juices, lukewarm water for tea, etc, the mini-bar was often not restocked, sometimes all the soap was taken away and not replaced, and if desk personnel were friendly one sensed it had more to do with their personality than with hotel policy (sometimes they were, sometimes not). The restaurant and cafe were scruffy (worn-out and mismatched tables and chairs) and unwelcoming, and indeed closed on Christmas Day. The whole place feels like the management responsible for the initial well-designed setup has been succeeded by incompetent fools.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Like The Plague!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AlyssiaGrove
Reviews.Content: This "hotel" is AWFUL!!!!!!!!!!!!!! My husband and I booked our first holiday in 15 years and wanted something special. What we got was a major NIGHTMARE!! We arrived in a dingy allyway having been up for over 36 hours due to flight times so all we wanted to do was get into the room, have a couple of hours sleep to freshen up and then start our sightseeing in earnest. The hotel lobby looked clean enough but the staff on the front desk were the most unhelpful hotel staff I have ever come across. The SNATCHED the travel agent's booking confirmation off us and refused to give it back even tho it had the Italian Rep's number on it. once booked in the porter couldn't do enough to help us, although we reckon it's because he thought he would get a good tip from us. We got to the room and this is where the dissapointment started. We had booked a smoking room and were dismayed to find that a smoking room is classed as a room with a balcony that you can stand on (*there's not furniture on the balcony) and have your cigarette on there. OK we thought, not a problem we can deal with this. I wanted to freshen up after being stuck in airports or on planes for the past 36 hours so I went to have a quick shower and lo and behold flooded the bathroom!!!! We had to make 3 telephone calls and a visit to reception to even get someone to come and look at it. The response was ALL the bathrooms in the hotel flood when you have a shower, it's the way it's been designed!!!!! The "bathroom" is tiny, there is barely room for one person in there and as for storing toiletries well you may as well forget that there is NO storage space. As for wardrobe space you can forget that too as the hotel is classed as a modern boutique, by this they mean cheap and nasty ikea style with no hanging space except a rail and a couple of tiny shelves tacked onto the back of the bed's headboard which incidentally is in the middle of the room!!!!!! They advertise that they have satelite tv in all the rooms, i'm still waiting to find it!!!!! We decided to take a nap and go to the restaurant for dinner when we woke up. OH MY what a surprise! Did you know during the month of August even tho it's the busiest tourist season the hotel Ripa CLOSES the restaurant???????!!!!!!!!!!!????????? What kind of hotel closes a restaurant in the middle of tourist season? I have never heard of such a thing. Grafitti and burnt out cars aside, hubby and I decided to try and find somewhere to eat and managed to find a little restaurant on a corner not too far away from the hotel even tho we were both a little unnerved by the location. we had quite a lovely meal. next day we hoped would be an improvement but sadly it was not to be so after just one night of a booked 5 night stay we decided to check out and move to the Hotel Excedra (review to come). when we informed the desk clerk we were checking out he acted incredulous and just could not understand why we would do such a thing even tho he claims we had only booked for 2 nights (travel agent confirmation is 5 nights so they are investigating this) The clerk messed about for a good 45 minutes before deciding to "allow" us to check out. [PLEASE PLEASE AVOID THIS HOTEL THE STAFF ARE RUDE AND INCOMPETANT AND THE HOTEL IS DISGUSTING!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: KaciLyford
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ripa should not be a four star hotel. I should have listened to the reviews on this website - instead I decided to learn for myself. The hotel may have been a boutique hotel - many years ago. They have not maintained the look or decor since the opening of the hotel. Minor drywall and paint issues everywhere, which could easily be fixed, would make all of the difference. Our room had an awful smell, mildew grew on the bathroom walls, cracks and peeling texture on the bedroom walls, the A/C unit dripped, and the hotel staff was stuck up and rude. The breakfast was the worst we had our entire trip through Italy. I would never stay at the Hotel Ripa again, and would not suggest it to anyone else. Believe the reviews on this website!

Reviews.Title: “A major disappointment”
Reviews.Author: HMR
Reviews.Content: Good, reasonably priced hotel rooms are hard to come by in Rome. The Hotel Ripa looked fairly good from it's website, but what a disappointment. These days it seems that the term 'boutique hotel' can be applied to anything with minimalist furniture and an austere interior. Minimalism looks good when it's new and just out of the wrapper, but after a few years when the chrome starts chipping, the white geometric sofas are stained and the fixtures and fittings could do with replacing, the concept starts to take on the look of a cheap IKEA floor display. This was just part of what disappointed us at the Hotel Ripa. The building itself is cold and unwelcoming. I'm certain that it was a 1970s office block at one point and maintains the feel of one. Whoever designed the rooms left a lot to be desired as there was nothing remotely functional about them; not enough room to put toiletries, a hairdryer that was so melted that it no longer fit in it's wall slot, no towel racks, no drawers, no moveable furniture, taps that didn't work, nowhere to stow suitcases, etc. Housekeeping failed to replenish the shower gel, soap, shampoo or mini-bar throughout our stay, as well. The Hotel Ripa boasts that each room has a balcony, but what's the point of having one if there was no furniture on which to sit and enjoy the surroundings? We noticed that other rooms had a chair or two outside, while ours and the room next to ours was lacking even that. Breakfast was good - if you could ignore the flies crawling over the cold meats and cheeses. We passed on that. I'm totally amazed that this hotel has been given a four star rating when it clearly deserves no more than three stars.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good 3* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: deco,cork
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 7 adult couples that stayed here on 6th -9th October 2006. Ideally placed for easy access to all of central Rome. Tram to take you to city centre just a 100 metres from the front door. Rooms by European standards were big. Bathrooms excellent, but shower curtain(heavy plastic) was more a design statement than a more practical fitment. Complaints none. Breakfast adequate, but for a 4* hotel would not expect tinned fruit as partof the breakfast fruit option. Staff all friendly and helpful. Even though it wants to be a funky hotel it needs a some brightening up. Would we go back, yes for definite.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: sc257
Reviews.Content: Expensively priced and calling itself a four star boutique establishment, we had high hopes for this hotel. How wrong we were. The room -- allegedly a junior suite -- was pokey with a bizarre "sub-Japanese" concept (an error) which meant the bed was in the middle of the room. The bathroom door didn't work and you could see everytime someone went to the toilet. Their was a horrible smell of damp and the wallpaper was peeling off the walls. The water refused to drain from the shower plug. There was only one plug -- so EITHER the television OR the minibar (soft drinks only) worked at once, not both. Some of the lights didn't work, others could only be turned off using the bedside switch, not on You had to stand on the bed to change the air-conditioning, which sounded like a Category Five hurricane all night. The view from the balcony was hideous. The breakfast was extremely dodgy: the reason the tea is cold is because they heat the water in pans then use a ladel to spoon it into the container We would have complained, but the staff were surley and irritable and instead we decided just not to spend any time in the hotel. Our verdict: Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, service could do with an upgrade !!”
Reviews.Author: Woozie70
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July... The hotel was well out of the way of the main street, and would have been difficult to find had it not been for a taxi driver...the room we had was clean, very art-deco and altogether top class... Modern electrics (shutters, blinds etc), japanese style bed, plasma screen tv etc... The main tram line was only 2 minutes walk away and with frequent trams, journeys into the centre were easily accomplished....and they run well into the night....although if you want to walk, it's a 20 minute journey....but well worth it... The hotel is not in that great an area, but we had no problems at all....although one thing we did notice about Rome were the beggars !! One thing they do need to sort out though are their staff....the front desk staff were the rudest I have ever witnessed, and had no interest in assisting their guests...the bellhops were friendly though...maybe they need to switch roles !!! Overall.....I'd recommend this hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Kind staff, good location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: Hariette
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff assisted us very well. Our room was large, quiet, very well kept and clean. Decoration is nice (although I do agree that on the website it looks better because of the flashy pictures). Location is excellent - tramway close and many nice restaurants and terraces in Trasteverre at walking distance for nice evenings out. The only thing we did not like was the drinks at breakfast (not real juices) and we saw many other guests leaving their unfinished drinks every morning - staff should take action upon this.

Reviews.Title: “If you can afford to stay elsewhere, don't make this mistake”
Reviews.Author: tracylynette
Reviews.Content: I'll admit that my husband and I have pretty high standards when it comes to hotels. We knew that this wouldn't be a 5 star experience but having booked the "best room" in the hotel, we looked forward to staying in a pretty nice space. Well, to our dismay the shower made a nice little (or actually pretty big) flood and the patio door was not closeable or lockable. It wasn't acceptable. So we changed rooms to a lower grade, which is what they had available. This room was actually better than the best room, but the view was terrible. The hotel backs to these horribly ugly apartments and an alley. As everyone else has stated, the location is not great - about a 20 minute walk, 10 minute cab ride from all the good stuff. I recommend finding a hotel somewhere near the Spanish Steps. It's worth the money. The food was just ok. Most of the staff was helpful although we did have to call more than once to get moved to a new room. The decor is definitely different. Bottom line, If this is your "big trip to Rome," spend the money on nicer accomodations. If you're ok with these kinds of inconveniences and want to get your workout in by walking miles to the best sites in Rome, this hotel should fit you fine.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible staff, unsave hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grouptourlider
Reviews.Content: October 2003 I was in Ripa hotel with a group of officers from Chile. Hotel services are normal, rooms more or less clean, but what happened in this hotel with this group in incredible. We left hotel after breakfast of second day and returned in the evening. The surprise was waiting us. In my case I couldn't open the save box, where was my passport, so that I cold to reception and said that. 5 minuts after then cam a member of the staff and opened it with the "secret code": 1234, he told me that it was the same for all save box, ploffff. When I cam back to reception, there was one member of the group explaining that from the save box in his room was stealed 100 dollars, then cam the second with the same history and so till 10 persons, all said that the money was in save box, the quantity were from 50 till 150 usd or euro per person. The hotel's manager said that they had a contract with an insurance company and they will response for that and the company will do the same later. I did a declaration in Carabinieri Trastevere and gave a copy of the document to the manager. At the following day, the manager said that it will be very difficult to return the money, because the insurance company needed to do some investigation about, and maybe in the next (and last day in Rome for us), we'll receive the money. Next day before we leaved hotel I asked about the money (total 1350 US dollars), and the manager told me that will be impossible to return money in that moment for instructions of insurance company. We arrived back to Chile and wrote to the insurance company and they answered that this contract was no more valid, so that they will any money return to us. I wrote to hotel and they never answered. All people in the group think that were members of the staff the responsable for this act, because in almost all room in 4th floor were opened the save box, and token only part of the money where it was, maybe thinking people will not note it if they take a little part of the money. That was my and 68 people experience in Ripa hotel. I have yet all documents about notification in Carabinieri and several emails in my office, never nothing happened and the hotel didn't answered for the theft So, friends, be careful!! If you go to hotel Ripa, don't leave any money in save box, it's not save!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Location near the bus”
Reviews.Author: traveling_carol
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome July 4 at 9 pm. The taxi driver did not know where the hotel was located, it was his first day as a driver. After asking other taxi drivers he found the hotel. The room was in good condition except that the storm shutters were down and we could not raise them. I never got around to asking why. There is a grocery store near by, an inexpensive internet & phone service across the street where the bus stop was and great restaurants within walking distance. Hint for those who want to save the $15 Euros to get to the train station, catch the H bus! It was nice to have an out of the way hotel, we were there during the world cup championship, we could still hear some noise from the main streets but it wasn't too bad. This is in regards to the transportation, not the hotel, there were several bus and/or taxi strikes going on so we learned to ask at the hotel before we left if we wanted to catch the bus. The showers were difficult to keep from soaking the floor, we tried all sorts of ways to hold the shower curtain, even putting the towels along the top of the tub to hold in the water. We had brought our own shamppoo, don't know if it normally not placed in the rooms or we were just unlucky.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't !”
Reviews.Author: DEMOSTHENE
Reviews.Content: Bad location and very bad service. Do not beleive the pictures, most of the rooms are in a very bad shape, cheap and old 70's furnished, poor condition, and dirty. The breakfast is just ridiculous. Despite our 3 nights reservation we decided to lose our money and change.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel. Location pretty bad”
Reviews.Author: hawaiiguy931
Reviews.Content: When I came across a 4 star hotel in Rome on the internet for so cheap, i automatically booked it. I forgot to think WHY it might have been so cheap. The room overall was okay, but on the back of the door there was a huge sticky mess, which I still don't want to know what it was. We had arrived at 4PM, and only had 1 night in Rome since we had to catch our Cruise from Civitavecchia. We arrived via taxi from the Airport and were not too happy with the area. It was not so bad of a bad area as it was just trashy. Hotel was very close to the Colliseum, the one thing we made time for, and when we got there they were all on strike. But thats a different story. The free breakfast was below average, with very few cold and stale pastries to offer. Roll A Way bed very uncomfortable, I was up from 1AM to 6AM. The hotel was somewhat close to a river, which if you walk the streets around it, you see actual Rome, like not the tourist part. The staff was HORRIBLE!!! When the taxi was unloading our bags, he did it very quickly, and drive off with my brand new laptop, and ipod and wallet. We asked the hotel to call around to a couple different taxi companies, and they said no. We told them we were going to go to the airport and file a police report, and they said ust forget about it. 2 Hours later it was good to show them they were wrong. Very modern, smaller hotel with under 200 rooms, nice bathroom and hotel furnishing were superb. Most likely we will not return to The Hotel Ripa, but if you have a lot of time in Rome, and, want to see the real Rome, you might want to try this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay - a bit rundown and not four stars like some sites show”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The photos of Ripa are better than the actual hotel. I was expecting a lot more. The service was good and the front desk was very friendly and helpful. The Riparte Cafe is good. The downfall is that the bathroom was tiny and the water was apparently turned off at night (we could not flush the toilet from about 8 pm to 8 am) and we could smell sewage and sulfur all night. I was grossed out by the bathrooms and won't be back for that reason alone. The room needed to be painted and the carpet was a bit old. The apartment behind the Ripa is run down on the outside and the entire area needs to be renovated, though the Trastavere area is supposed to be a nice residential area. I did find that the hotel is easily accessibly to the center of town. I would not pay more than 150 Euro a night here. Otherwise, there are a few 4-star hotels that I'd spend an extra 50-100 Euro per night for the comfort of a 4 star hotel (I am a regular business traveler). If you are a student traveler, this is a great hotel for the price. The Ripa was hot about four years ago and needs a face-lift.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot to begin and end a busy day.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome, and booked the Ripa based on location, style and price. We had seen reviews- both good and bad. We were so very pleased to find a hotel that met all of our needs for the week we were in Rome. The staff was more than helpful, arranging a van to pick us up at the airport. The rooms were hip & modern, but sparse. The twin beds were most comfortable with crisp linins and fluffy duvets. We had everything we needed, A/C, elevators, phone, Tv, hair dryer, mini fridge, balcony with a view of Trastevere. This area is the 'Ghetto', mostly residential around the hotel. The #8 tram goes to Argentinia, minutes from Piazza Navona. The #3 goes to the Piramide Metro stop. The stop is a block away; the front desk is happy to sell tickets and provide information.
